After that, you get your own coffee.  I'm happy to get the exercise of walking back and forth to the coffee, cream and Splenda.

I always get their breakfast sandwich special combo which consists of a perfectly cooked eggs, ham, bacon and their special sweet sauce. The service is always a warm smile upon entering. Also try their Chai Latte if you are a fan of Chai or want to become one. their dessert waffles and pizza waffles are very good as well, the smell is incredible Mmmm

This place for just a waffle shop is so quaint and and quiet you almost feel like there might be something wrong with the food lol but there wasn't. I had a waffle sandwich and well as surprising as that sounds it was very good. It had fresh avocado and bacon as well as ham and it was superb! Alright more about the place. Well,  it has a pretty decent sized menu filled with what ever waffle fantasy creation you could think of and the prices are under $10 but above 5$ for almost all plates or waffle creations! The restaurant has lots of seating as well if you felt like you need to bring your football team or large family for some waffle goodness =)

Amazing waffles!! If you like your waffles flaky and light then you will love this place. I got the breakfast sandwich with turkey it was amazing. The cashier at the counter really made some great recommendations on what to try and we were very pleased with both of our orders. We also tried the "sweet-p" and it also did not disappoint at all. The ONLY reason I'm forced not to give this place 5 stars is that it was pretty dirty inside and we were the only two people in here. I'll definitely come back here. I think if they cleaned this place up and spend a little money on the inside it would no doubt take it to 5 stars easy.

I don't know how this place gets all these great ratings.   I had the 2 eggs, bacon, waffle breakfast with hash browns on side.  Nothing special, in fact, I could have had fast food and not paid as much.  I suppose if you were to go there for your overly indulgent sweet tooth then it will hit the spot.   As for me, I will not be a return customer.   I would have rather waited in line at Babystacks.
This was a great waffle place, the waffles were amazing, I got a Nutella waffle And my friend got a white chocolate raspberry waffle, everyone was very friendly, I will be coming back.

This restaurant has thee best iced chai latte I've ever had! This was my first time visiting and I must say, I was very surprised at their diverse menu selection and reasonable prices. Also, I was pleasantly surprised at the wait for my food. I placed a to-go order and and ordered the breakfast sandwich meal and it was finished in no time. I didn't catch his name but the gentleman working there even brought my to-go order to my table where I was waiting. That's A1 customer service right there!! I'll definitely be back to try other waffles in the future!

If Yelp told me to jump off a bridge would I do it? Hum? I guess if the bungee jumping company was highly recommended! Ha Ha!  Once again, yelp has led me to another terrific place: Waffles Cafe!! We have come here twice now and loved the whole thing! The place is clean, the staff are friendly and honest, the food is yummy, the concept is unique, and it's family owned (got to support that, love that!!).

We love coming here. It's close to home, low key, & the food is tasty. The staff is always friendly & the wait is never long. I like that I can bring my noisy, messy 11 month old.  I usually get the breakfast sandwich & a strawberry banana smoothie. Hits the spot!

Amazing food and amazing service! The waffles sandwiches are really good too. Want boba? Yep! They have that too! Highly recommend the breakfast sandwich or the turkey sandwich, where they use a waffle as the bread. They put this amazing house sauce on their sandwich that gives it a great taste.
Not a bad choice if you want to change it up. Lots of things with a waffle you probably wouldn't think of. Service is a bit spotty.

You can't go wrong with waffles. I had a turkey club which had waffles instead of bread and had a super sweet syrup like sauce. Which was a bit different. I kind of wish I ordered off the regular waffle menu instead. But there's always next time. Service was great. Decently priced.

First time I had a waffle breakfast sandwich. - loved it!  Staff was super friendly and they work fast. I ordered 10 meals to go and they got on it right away.  Definitely will have breakfast here again when I'm back in Vegas!
It was alright. Great service and all. Very nice little place. Food was good, but not out of this world either

Came here last year with my girl and the food was awesome. Of course in our first trip back to Vegas for the new year she wants waffles cafe again. I'd have to say it's still as delicious as the first time. I had the blazing chicken and waffles and it was a hit. Waffles are soft and don't fall apart. Chicken wasn't over cooked and the wait staff was great and did mind going over the entire menu with us. I'd say skip all the fancy breakfast/ brunch spots on the strip and check waffles out. You'll be back. Tell em cam from the chi sent you.

I had the pancakes with strawberries and it was awesome. Others in my group had waffles , chocolate chip pancakes and a fruit bowl.  All loved it.  Only warning: if you're looking at the hash browns be aware they are McDonald's style not restaurant style.  Would definately go back.

How did it have 4 stars, this is my firs time doing a review... I usually like the places with 4 or 5 stars, this is the first time I didn't like it at all. I had the breakfast sandwich and it had no flavor. I had to drench it with syrup. My wife had a piece of hair stuck to her bacon, just broke off the part of the bacon. We  just did a drive from El Paso we were hungry. What a let down. If any one asks me if I want to eat there... NOPE

Great waffles. Warm syrups, Nice friendly owner and staff.  What a pleasant surprise. Had the egg sausage potato scramble with a side of country gravy and it was good. We also had a waffle with fresh fruit which was really good!  Give it a try you won't be disappointed!

I love their waffle breakfast sandwich! In my opinion it's the only thing good here. I've been here a lot and have really tried to love this place but After trying most of the menu the food really isn't that good. They are friendly and fast service but nothing is really that tasty. The bacon seems to be precooked and just reheated which tastes fine in the sandwich but not on it's own. The hash brown is like the frozen patties you buy and just deep fry- nothing special. The eggs are fluffy and perhaps poured from a carton and on the mushy side but again, in the sandwich they're good but we ordered a side of them and it was mushy. The waffles are average but the breakfast sandwich is where it's at. It comes with potato chips on the side which is interesting but I love the sweet sauce in the sandwich followed by the salty chips. I can't see myself going back here for anything else. If they ever took it off the menu I would probably never come back. They get 3 stars- 1 for friendly service, 1 for quick service, and 1 for the breakfast sandwich.

A little out of the way from the strip, but it was nice to have a breakfast that wasn't expensive hotel food one day.  The place is cute and the people are very nice. The waffles are a bit different then what I am used to, kind of crispy outside and soft inside, my family was impressed that there was real fruit on them rather than sometype of fruity-mixed-topping. Go for the organic flax waffle it was better than the regular!!

First timers. So glad we finally checked out! Delicious breakfast at affordable prices. Service was fast and courteous. Appreciated how they accommodated my little ones special requests. The waffles were amazing! All of the fruit was fresh. We also tried one of their waffle sandwiches... amazing as well! Definitely recommend. Wished we would have tried sooner!!!!

Great breakfast and brunch spot. Great for groups and children. A lot of menu items to choose from. Plenty of seating and not a long wait. Prices are affordable. Worth a drive if you're in the area. Waffle batter is tasty didn't even need syrup. Had the red velvet and created my own 3 side meal. Everything was delicious no complaints. Will be back for sure to taste rest of menu as there was a lot to choose from. Staff was friendly and attentive. Met one owner and she introduced herself and was talking with most customers. You can tell this establishment cares about their customers.

I was a little apprehensive to trying this out but im so glad I did. Its a quiet, bright, & warm Saturday morning. Kim greeted me pleasantly as I walked through the door and asked if this was my first visit. She offered to walk me through the menu and gave me a few minutes to make a selection.   I ordered the blazing chicken & waffle w/ hash browns & an orange smoothie. About 8 minutes later it was in front of me and it was delicious. The waffle was soft (making for a good wrap), the tomatoes and lettuce tastes fresh, and the chicken didn't disappoint either. Overall I think the best description would be fresh & vibrant.  Onto the atmosphere. As stated, Kim was extremely pleasant. The dining room is a mix between a small-ish brunch spot (as youd expect) with some hints of a 50s diner. Theres a flatscreen TV on the wall that was tuned into smooth hits of the 60s, 70s, and 80s that fit well with the mood of the place.  Definitely looking forward to coming back here sometime and trying some of the other interesting menu items.

Great service and amazing food! Yes its paper plates and plastic forks but food quality is what matters to me! Ordered eggs, bacon, and the best friend (oat waffle with peanut butter, nutella, whipped cream, and banana).

YES YES YES! I love this place. We went here on our way to Red Rock Canyon and it was perfect place to go for a quick, cheap breakfast. When I first walked in, it reminded me of a Chinese take out place. The walls are bright orange and everyone is especially smiley and friendly. You order at the counter and then they bring everything to you. The employee at the counter was really helpful and didn't mind answering our questions and suggesting meals that we each might like (which, by the way, he did a very good job of because the food was amazing.)   I ordered the waffle sandwich- turkey, lettuce, bacon, avocado, tomato, special sauce...YUM. My dad got the strawberry waffles, my mom ordered the waffle breakfast sandwich, and my brother ordered waffle pie or something. The place is innovative, clean and the kind of place you feel good supporting. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'm definitely going back.

Super yummy! The staff was super friendly and the restaurant was very clean and low key. We walked in and were asked if we have dined here before, after saying no the employee asked if we needed her to go over the menus. I thought this was very nice considering all of the staff being younger and really caring about our experience. We ordered and sat where we wanted. Upon sitting the owner was in the back and greeted many who walked in. We didn't wait too long for our meal and everything was fresh. We ordered an orange smoothie and a cantaloupe bona smoothie super refreshing! Chicken and waffles along with a red velvet waffle. The chicken tenders on the waffle was absolutely scrumptious. All white meat, i didnt have to dissect through any of the meat which I tend to do because im extremely picky with my white meat. Comes with a blazing sauce which isn't too spicy, your choice of maple syrup (flavored, plain or sugar free) and a wonderful strawberry butter on top DIVINE. The red velvet pancake didnt really burst with red velvet flavor for me. It was topped with whipped cream, powdered sugar and a sweet glaze on top and on the side should you require more. It was  a sweet treat to end out chicken and waffles brunch item. My husband loved the red velvet, I on the other hand was just ok with it, but it wasn't bad, just super sweet and he picked the item so i wont take any stars for that because its a personal preference really. Just know its very sweet, if you love that then try it! The price point in super affordable compared to actual Diners. $8.50 for the chicken and waffles and $4.50 for the red velvet. Smoothies range based on size and if you want boba beads or other toppings $3.99-5.99-ish. They offer happy hour specials after 2pm on the drinks buy one get one 50% off SWEET! I totally would come back and recommend anyone to give this place a try. Oh the owner also came over to our table to check on everything, nice touch!

Today was my first time here and what a delightful experience it was; the waffles are so fresh and the variety of toppings are endless! Waffles Cafe will definitely be my new place to go for waffles in the future.
I had a strawberry wheatgrass smoothie.. I forgot to add boba, but it's the best consistency for on the go. Amazing waffles and chicken. Fluffiest pancakes I've had in forever

I absolutely love Waffles! So it was a no-brainer to check this place out. Cute concept. Waffles with just about any topping and filling (turkey & cheese, sandwich waffle)  you can think up. They even offer boba which is hard to find in North Las Vegas so that's was cool.   Unfortunately the waffles were just OK, they definitely weren't the best I've ever had. But my kids loved it so we'll be back! I guess I was expecting more from a place called Waffles Cafe. Another thing to mention, the customer service has always been outstanding, keep up the good work!

One of the best waffles I've had in a looong time!  Belgian style, very crispy, light and tasty, not doughy or heavy.  The bacon looked lame but tasted very good.  Scrambled eggs were cooked just right (wet but not runny).  Service was great; nice people.  Small dining area. Also had a chocolate peanut butter shake that had really great flavor (not a real thick shake so your throat won't hurt trying to suck it up, and not too thin that you're wondering if it's ice milk)!  And yes, milkshake for breakfast!
Waffles with bananas and peanut butter, you just can't beat it!  Prices were very reasonable too! A great little place to grab some breakfast!

This joint is the jam! Just moved to LV and a friend took me here, it's off the chain. Diverse and unique menu, some of the best waffles I've ever had, Jeff and Co. are super friendly and a big part of why I return even though it's a 20 min drive. Please ignore those douchy guys who post these reviews with 2 stars and criticize the paint and tile pattern. You couldn't sound any less manly if you tried there Martha Stewart. Go to Waffles Cafe, no regrets for sure.
First time here waffles were very good just wish I would have had a waiter and menu at my table. Paper plate and plastic forks were a disappointment. But over all food was good.

Great little breakfast/brunch/lunch place.  Yummy Breakfast Sandwich using a Belgium Waffle s the bread, and great service - from the cashier to the owners son. Can't wait to try their Hawaiian Pizza Waffles. We will be back often.

Not impressed. Came here for my husbands birthday because of all the great reviews but was very disappointed. Ordered the breakfast special, bacon was dry and looked microwaved, over medium eggs (that came out over hard) my waffle was cold the butter didn't even melt on it. My sons scrambled eggs had a rather large egg shell in them. The hash browns were pre-made McDonald's style. All in all food quality was poor. Only giving two stars for the friendly staff.
We loved the food and would definitely come back! Owner was very friendly and helpful. Found this place from yelp and was very pleased. My family loved it too.

Food 9/10 Best waffle's I've had in Vegas ever. Highly recommend the flax waffle.   Drinks 7/10 Standard soft drinks, breakfast combo comes with unlimited coffee, Thai Tea had too much thai tea and not enough condensed milk (aka way too orange)  Environment 8/10 Good breakfast sunshine from the windows in the morning, and nice and cool during the hot summer days. Not a fan of Styrofoam plates and cups when eating in, but its understandable.   Enjoyment 9/10 I have gone to this place at least two dozen times. Great food, great family, and very accommodating if anything went wrong.   Overall 33/40 = 82.5% = 4 stars.   I grew up in the east coast, DC area to be exact. When most people think of a Waffle house, one can't help but think of Fried Chicken and Belgian waffles and a slightly dirty Denny's style diner. Sadly that's what I thought of when I first approached "WaffleS". This was not the case  First impression is its super clean environment and bright lights. It's definitely not an ethnic style waffle house. This is done asian style, hence the 'Cafe in WaffleS Cafe. And I can tell you I'm definitely a fan of this place. The first time going there you'll get a small culture shock as all your stereotypes get blown out of the water, THEN you'll get a little shock at the different varieties and styles of waffles you can choose from, literally a plethora of combinations.   When you decide from choosing between a standard, pizza, or sandwich waffle, you have 5 types of batter. From there, there's a a few dozen toppings from anchovies to strawberries, lets not forget all the syrups and such.   If you want a waffle your way you will get it your way. My personal favorite is the standard flaxseed waffle with maple syrup. But if i feel a little indulgent, you can't help but try Yooni's Favorite: Plain Waffle, with bananas, strawberries, whipped cream, and a scoop of vanilla ice cream, topped with chocolate syrup.

We love this cafe! The waffles are amazing. The potatoes were a favorite. They have a large variety of choices and everything we have tried was great. The service is wonderful and all of the employees are polite and attentive. Our new favorite breakfast destination.
had groupon drove clear across town monday 11/14/2011. strange no cars there.little sign on door. closed we are moving.when and where dont know.
Egg, bacon, & ham waffle sandwhich... nuff said!

This waffle joint is a half mile from Aliante Casino.  When my relatives start hitting the slots, they say I'm bad luck if I watch, so they tell me to scram."We'll be here a half hour, see you then..."  They say they kinda feel sorry for me, but they get over it, and so do I.  Why?  It gives me an excuse to head to Waffles Cafe.   Carbs rarely ever taste this good.  I love waffles, and this waffle by itself is near perfect -  light, slightly sweet, tender, and slightly crispy all at the same time.  When it comes out warm, no matter what it's topped with, it's heavenly.  This time, I opted for the peaches and strawberries.  The peaches were sliced canned cling peaches, which I like, but I loved the sliced fresh strawberries with a dollop of whipped cream in the middle.  I decided to get it to go and eat it in the parking lot of the casino, well aware the Casino videotapes the parking lots.  All I can say to the security staff watching my one tape, "Get your own!" The aromatic, juicy berrie slices were naturally sweet with the waffle, the peaches were a good contrast visually, in taste, and texture.   The variety of waffles is fantastic, you can order one of their pre made concoctions, or create your own.  There is nutella, pumpkin, pecan, apples, blueberries, and so many others.  They have a great $5.49 breakfast waffle special with egg, bacon or sausage, and can add hash browns for a price. Of course, waffle sandwhiches are popular, too.   They had some bobas and teas.  But I had their Columbian coffee to go, it was decent, though I prefer my coffees bolder (i.e. French Roast) but it was a great accompaniement to my sweet dessert.  All told, it was about $8.  Definitely, I'll come back again.  My relatives didn't win this time, but in a half hour, I was far happier and my wallet was heavier than theirs.

I'm just not sure what people are eating around here, and whoever coming to this place saying it's good needs to stay out of this Vegas heat and go get their head checked....  on to the review.  first, walked in and I'm hit with a smell/stench. it smells like..you know when throw up dries on clothing and you get a wif of it? that was my first thought when I walked in.  sat down with the fam at a table with a open coke can on it and looked over to the menu on the wall. they do a good presentation of the images of the waffles, so I got the breakfast meal with oj. also got some scramble eggs and a waffle pizza.  waited about 8-10 minutes before some of the food got dropped off. this is where the 1 star came in.  when you pay $30+ for food, you don't expect your meal on paper plates. as soon as I saw the plate I thought "oh fantastic this is going to be a waste". and there my 2 eggs with dried, flat cheap bacon sat on a small round paper plate you find at target. then the waffle on a large white plate you find probably from Costco.  also when a restaurant has waffle in the name, they should really make sure their batter is kicking and cooked properly. the waffles come kind of well done, not fluffy or soft with crisp edges and there's a scoop of warm margarine, not then real butter.  rest of the food dropped off, nothing special at all. paper plates, plastic forks, aftermarket orange juice in a 16oz see thru plastic cup. just garbage presentation and food all around.  I just waited for everyone to finish, annoyed, wanting to get out of here.   if I wanted a Costco meal I'd go get samples for free.   poor presentation, poor quality food, one star is what they get. will not be coming back.  another suggestion is don't skimp and penny pinch on quality to serve value. we would have been better off going to McDonald's to get the breakfast plate, 3 of them.

The reviews make me feel like I just went on a bad day. The chicken and waffles were awful, And I'm a big C&W fan. The boba tea had hardly any boba. I felt sick after trying to eat some of my meal and just couldn't do it, which is quite rare for me lol. But really, I can't say anything good about this place, sorry. Oh wait!...I like the strawberry butter.

I was told by my roommate that this was a great spot around the corner from our house.... I was extremely disappointed. Never seen so many people on such a short cooking line take 30 minutes to make a scrabble and a waffle with only 1 order for a party of 5 ahead of us... multi tasking is not this staffs strong point. My biggest issue was the only flavors I could describe was burnt sausage and bacon. I would go into further details but not really into writing a book so I will just end with finding any other option would be the best alternative... Carl's Jr. Across the street perhaps.

I'm just waited 30 minutes for a Hawaiian pizza and a grilled chicken sandwich. And the place is empty. As soon as I walked up and asked for refund the pizza and chicken sandwich was ready. The person that ordered after me got their food before me and ordered a lot more. Ridiculous. Order at 11:04 am was brought out at 11:32 Am

The few times I've been in this restaurant the food has been great however today I had a problem. My son and I went in there and he is on a no sugar diet because of health issues. He requested no sugar in his smoothie and was told by the owner that there would be no sugar in his smoothie. Once drinking his smoothie he had a bad reaction to the sugar that was apparently in the smoothie because they didn't pay attention to the fact that he needed no sugar. I feel as if our needs were super not met by the owner of this establishment. She should know every ingredient in everything she is selling in her restaurant!

What a great cafe!  I had the original waffle with chocolate and peanut butter chips with whip cream.  I also got the combo meal with chocolate milk and bacon and eggs.  Everything was prepared with perfection and so tasty!  The staff, especially AJ, were super friendly and welcoming to me and everyone else.  I'll definitely come back next time I'm in North Las Vegas.  I hope I'm hungry enough for lunch today

Oh WOW!  My boyfriend and I have been trying to find a good deal and fantastic tasting food here in Vegas... This place is it!!!!! I Love Belgian waffles... Especially when they are crunchy and soft on the inside... I made up my own which I will call the Sarah's Favorite: Original waffle with fresh strawberries,sliced up bananas,walnuts,nutella spread and whipped cream.  My eyes rolled back in my head it was sooooooo good!! I definitely recommend this place.  I just wish there was one on the East side...

I've been coming to here since they opened. I normally get the double strawberry Nutella sandwich. So tasty! My boyfriend loves their breakfast sandwiches. I've tried almost everything on the menu at least once love pretty much all of it. The fruit is always fresh some of the veggies are pre-frozen but I've never minded. Also not sure why everyone cares it's served on paper plates? It's not that big of a deal. Also if restaurants do this. If the food is good, and it is, it shouldn't matter.

This place is fantastic!  Great pricing, outstanding service and the food... ugh I have to fight the urge to visit multiple times each week.   To top it all off, HGTV was on in the dining area. Heaven.  Give it a try, check out the options they have. I'm sure you'll find a favorite.

Excellent place to eat!  Service is fast. The owners are so nice. We have been going since they opened and we go every week. No other place like it in town. Once our son grew his first set of teeth he's been asking for waffles everyday. Love love love them!
Super freindly spot. Family owned and i cant stress how nice they were and offered great service. When it comes to the food.. it was good but i felt like i could easily make it at home.

The concept of a waffles joint that serves all sorts of waffles is great. However, you would expect a place that serves mostly waffles to know how to make a perfect waffle. Mine was very brown and crisp. Not only that, but the wait time was too long. We waited a good 15+ minutes before the food was served. When it came out, it was served on paper plates. The bacon and eggs could have been made better at home. When paying for food you expect the presentation to be better than what you would do at home. For the price paid, it was not worth it. It was my first time trying it and I won't be going back.
One of my favorite breakfast restaurants. They make gluten free waffles!! Family owned, local buisness.  It is amazing!!

You would think a place that specializes in waffles would appeal to almost everyone. I mean who the hell dont like waffles? They're crispy they're designed to have lots of surface area and can hold their own against fruit, ice cream, or hell even sandwich stuff.  So why dont I eat at waffles cafe more often?  The environment is pretty chill, the tables are clean the young ladies behind the counter are friendly and cheerful as well as darn attractive.   The waffles are damn tasty, the cucumber water...kinda tastes like cucumber tap water with a TDS (total dissolved solids) count of over 200.  A lot of pluses against one minus which isnt a big deal since i like to carry my own source of water in my car anyway...  So what is it about this place that prevents me from going too often...  Well i think the entire idea of this place was to appeal to younger crowds to gather and collectively consume waffles made in a variety of ways with numerous toppings and even savory waffles.  The thing that keeps me from seriously considering waffles cafe for a meal is the bang to buck ratio. There are much better deals elsewhere when you're in the mood to fill your belly up and WaffleS Cafe just doesnt fill me up enough at the cost of what i'm spending.   What about sweet waffles? If i were younger i'd love to drive out here, leech the free wifi (which is a pretty weak connection but still there) and have crispy waffle with sweet ice cream and colorful fruits decorating the plate while watching the pretty girls take orders and make waffles. I'm older now and my tastes have changed. Instead of craving something sweet i'd murder for Soyo or Pan Asian.  Be nice if they were open a little latter. Totally down for waffles after a weekly ritual of SoYo, but alas they close early.  The food is excellent and creative with numerous ways to customize something to your liking so finding something you'll really enjoy wouldnt be a problem at all. It's the practicality of spending a buck fifty for half a kiwi as a topping that makes customizing your own unrealistic and is what prevents me from giving the five stars this place deserves.

We were looking for an area for brunch and found this. Service was ok, menu looked great like really great but then our food came and it was just ok. . . .  1 i guess their waffles are obviously their main attraction but.  . . batter tasted like too much water, very light which wasn't able to taste the specified batter you choose. 2 very small portions for the price 3 too many flies, we were more concentrated on shooing them away then enjoying our food lol.  Other then that it is ok, i believe they have another location, maybe we will try it. Im not sure if this is a new joint but hopefully try to experiment new batter recipes.
Good food but don't come if you are in a hurry. Since they make everything fresh it does take a while. They have a good selection.

I used to enjoy this place alot. It has been a while since I've returned. The staff and look has changed a bit since but they are still nice. Unfortunately far as service and quality I was a bit under satisfied. For 2 potatoe scrambles and a half waffle we waited nearly a half hour. The kitchen itself had more than 6 people in it, the establishment itself had 3 parties that came after us and that was it for patrons in the restaurant. We watched parties get served and finished there entire meal before we even got ours. I could totally understand if they were busy but to have that many staff In the kitchen and to have so many open tables and having patrons wait that long i can't understand. Unfortunately I will not be coming back. To add to it, we ordered take out, and on the bottom of all 3 of our to go boxes were all holes. Why do take out boxes have holes on the bottom???? My rating was at 5, now down to 1. Staff you were nice but unfortunately quality of service was just not what it used to be....

Seen this place driving by several times before and finally we decided to plan breakfast here. Small place, friendly staff and extensive breakfast/waffle choices!!  Here's what we got:  1/2 Pumpkin & 1/2 Original Waffle: Yes it's one combined waffle and not separate halves. The Regular side tasted Alright.. It had a balanced flavor and most importantly the texture was right on!  Adding some silky butter and some syrup helped it a bit. On the other hand, the Pumpkin side tasted Much Better. Just the right of Pumpkin Goodness!  Sausage, Bacon & Egg Whites: Got these on the side.. Bacon were thin, crispy and short. Can't really go wrong with bacon but the portion was way too little. Egg whites were a palm full, tasted fine but again their portion was meant for Infants! Sausage same difference in serving size (a pair).Typical But Tasty!  Yooni's Favorite/Special: Original Waffle, Strawberry, Banana, Vanilla Ice Cream and Chocolate Sauce. I'm more of a simple kina waffle eater but this thing is quite the treat! Everything goes well with eachother and its one sweet way to start off a morning!!  Simple small shop, value was okay, I think a tad on the pricey side and really friendly service. I'd come back to try other waffle creations..

I guess maybe I'm spoiled with my supervisor's waffles...   We came here while waiting for an appointment nearby. I ordered the waffle with peanut butter. I can't remember what he ordered.   The waffles, in my opinion, felt very cheap - like the pre-made freezer versions - Eggos! They were too crisp and very bland/flavorless.   I will not be eating here - ever - again.
I love this waffle cafe. Food is great and it's always clean when I go.  The staff is very nice.
Waffles were tasty.  If you build your own it can get a bit pricey.  Ambience is cute.  This neighborhood needs places like this.

This was the dirtiest eating establishment I have EVER walked into. Floors ,walls,chairs,tables, everything was really dirty. If the front of the house was this dirty I can only imagine what the kitchen looked like.

My dad (84) and I went in yesterday for breakfast.  As we found out on a prior visit, Kim will accommodate special requests that aren't on the menu.  My dad had a tall stack of pancakes and I had the seasoned potatoes and regular sized yogurt parfait which was full of a variety of fresh fruit, granola, and yogurt.  Everything was delicious!! Kim is patient, friendly, and more than willing to answer questions.  The food is cooked after you order, and it is made with fresh ingredients.  You order at the counter, but your food and drinks are brought to your table. Kim and another person checked on us, refilled our drinks, and cleared away out plates.  So far, I have tried something new on each visit, and I have never been disappointed.  The food is hot and delicious or cold and delicious depending on what you order.  Customers are treated like they are the most important person in the place.  Everyone is friendly and helpful.  Customer service is definitely a priority.  I will definitely be back!

Was expecting more than paper plates and plastic silverware. Waffles were dry and my kids immediately said we should have stayed home and made waffles there. The coffee was weak as well. Not a great start for our morning!

The best waffles I have ever had! Wonderful staff! Friendly and helpful. Very clean environment. I had the pumpkin waffle with fruit. Side of fruit and sausage. Coffee was also delicious. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves waffles they are life changing!!!

Restaurant is not a typical breakfast place. You order at the counter and the menu is more of a build your own. Service was quick. Food is served on paper plates which didn't bother me but definitely something to note as it may bother some. Food was okay. I think $7 for a waffle with no eggs or sides is a bit pricey. Overall not a bad place and definitely something different.

I was in the area and wanted to take some friends to breakfast. I went here based on yelp reviews. While I think the food was good, it isn't a four or five star restaurant. With that said, the food was decent and it was a good value.   As a side note, A LOT of people who don't have handicap parking placards park in the handicap parking spots in this shopping center. Having a child who uses a walker and a wheelchair, this is very disheartening. You can read about her at HugsforHailey.com .
Everything about this place is amazing! I love the people and the employee's are always friendly and helpful. And the food is delicious

This is a unique, family owned cafe with awesome t-shirts (I love their iron man t-shirts)! They are very friendly and give good suggestions on what to order, since it was our first time there. The waffles aren't too soft or too hard, just perfect. The portion sizes are fairly large as well. I wouldn't mind stopping by here again, whenever I'm in the area.

We had chicken breast sandwich and shortcake waffle was very good.  Coffee was watery My waffle was lacking  flavor. However the ice cream had ice crystals through out the ice cream. The fruit was ok along with the chocolate syrup. They forgot our hot chocolate. Not sure if I will come back.
Delicious food, super-amazing service, good portions.   What more does anyone want? (Maybe a Cookie Butter Waffle please?!)

Heavenly is the only word to describe this place. It's simple and relaxed but very clean. The staff is always so nice whenever I go in. The waffle sandwiches are AMAZING simply for the sauce they put on them...don't know what it is and it looks kinda weird but it tastes sooooo good. Totally worth it!

Love everything about Waffles Cafe!!! I give major props to the young guys that are always in there because they really do provide great service.   I've only had breakfast there a couple times but I come in for Boba tea from time to time because it's conveniently located right off the 215.   Major plus also for not having a minimum to pay card.

Always stop by here when we go to vegas! Who wants the usual breakfast buffet from the hotel!  Stop by and try a nice tasty and fresh waffle sandwich...its a taste of heaven!  The service is excellent, and even though we have only been once, they remembered us from almost a year ago!

I love supporting small, family owned businesses. The people who own this place are so nice and friendly. No, the place is not fancy so if your coming here for pazazz, forget it. BUT if you want a perfectly cooked, delicious waffle that hits the spot you will not be disappointed. TONS of toppings to choose from, and so fresh. I will be back!

My husband's a waffle man but he's no push over. Not just any old waffle will do. So we were pleasantly surprised to find Waffles Café and we both enjoyed their light crispy waffles. The service is awesome. A friendly smile and pleasant hello does wonders in the morning before my brain is kick started by a cup of coffee. Everything is cooked to order. Tasty. An overall delicious breakfast joint.

My wife and I have been eating here since it's been open.  Great breakfast options.  The flaxseed waffles are to "live" for!  The owners and staff are very polite and welcoming.  It's everything you need if you don't feel like cooking breakfast at home.

THE CHICKEN AND WAFFLES MEAL IS BEAUTIFUL. It had two sauces: one for the chicken and one for the waffle. The syrup was served warm. 10/10 would come back again. Also, the cashier is so welcoming. She makes you feel important and comfortable.

I love this place and I've been going here to eat breakfast since I moved in the NW about 7 years ago.  I love their concept on waffle sandwiches and back then there was a few places that offer this Idea.  Until this day, their service and food has been consistent on my every visits.

Staff is extremely friendly, the waffles are awesome (my favorite one to get is the cherry blossom, it has cherries, vanilla ice cream, and a nice fluffy chocolate waffle underneath, yummm) they do have a little complimentary water station too which is super nice. Oh! And they have boba! Definitely give their boba a try, I normally get the melon one!
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!! Hand's down my favorite waffle place by far! And the customer service is great! jeff actually let me take a picture of him with his favorite waffle!

My good friend took me here my last trip to Vegas. I told her I wanted to find some cheap eats so she suggested this place. I make waffle sandwiches at home so I was pretty excited when she told me about it.  The place was empty which scared me like "where are the customers? is the food even good?" I wasn't about to make my friend search for a another place so I kept my mouth quiet. She told me to get the chicken sandwich, but they RAN OUT OF CHICKEN? So we both settled for the turkey waffle sandwich. Which was your basic turkey sandwich, but instead of bread you had a waffle and instead of mayo you get this "sweet sauce". Honestly I wasn't impressed... actually I was pissed off. I guess if you like mixing sweet with savory this is your place. But I personally would never come here again. No flavor and the fact that they were running out of ingredients on a Friday afternoon was pretty annoying.

Wow just reading some of the other reviews just now and they seem harsh but hey I guess that;s their experience.  My aunt and I go about once a month when we get a hankering for a waffle (when you are constantly one a diet and trying to lose weight you have to splurge a little:) and the waffles we get are quite good.  We both just go old school and get the classic waffle with some fruit on it and that's about it but the price is reasonable and they always seem done and have a nice crunch to it.  The wait time can be a little long especially for not a busy place but I think they keep just one or two people on as staff and that could make the wait time a bit slow.  Overall I think its a yummy neighborhood spot.
My people, they have gluten free waffles!! And they taste awesome! It's been ages since I could eat a waffle and now I can. Yaaaaaas!

I like this location even better than the one near me. Staff is super sweet and the layout is very nice. Oh yeah and the gluten free waffles just happen to be the bomb.com. Crunchy on the inside but chewy on the inside. Drooool......

The Skinny: the waffles are okay but nothing special - be careful about what you order though (3) Service: it's counter service but it's friendly (3) value: it's okay - not terribly expensive but not terribly cheap either when you factor in the cost of toppings.  Ordered the breakfast special (original waffle, egg and sausage for $5.49) and the strawberry waffles x 2 (around $7-ish). To clarify, we expected the original waffle with fresh strawberries on top however it turned out to be strawberry-flavoured waffles.  The eggs and sausage were a little on the bland side. The original waffle was satisfying crisp however lack sweetness. They are not belgian waffles that have that eggy/buttery/cookie goodness. You really need to drench those suckers in syrup.  The strawberry waffles were sweeter than the original flavour however lack the appropriate texture - not quite as crisp and a little too cakey. Nor did the waffle retain any strawberry flavour at all.  Overall, not a bad place to eat but not exceptional either. I would recommend coming in small groups due to the lack of seating in this small establishment.

I've passed by this place probably a hundred times. Not sure why I never stopped. My wife and I decided to give it a try and we weren't disappointed. She got the breakfast sandwich and I got the buffalo chicken sandwich. They both came on a waffle. You get to choose from chips, hash brown, of waffle fries. Get the waffle fries. Then they have like 7 or 8 seasonings you can have. I tried the salt & vinegar. Was pretty amazing.   There was so many options so we will be back for another go. Especially for happy hour to try one of there shakes.

No frills but a family fave!!! We love the service they are so friendly and always remember you. The waffles are very light, airy and delicious. The fruit waffle sandwich is really yummy. The prices are great the have a breakfast combo with a waffle, meat, eggs, and coffee for like 5 or 6 buck! Great, friendly, peaceful little place to grab s cup of coffee and enjoy family time for brunch.

a homemade waffle joint down the street from my house??? i must be the luckiest girl in the world!  there are many items on the menu but the best item is the BYOW (build your own waffle). your choice of waffle type and toppings. that's all me, man!  i got the organic flax waffle with strawberries, bananas and mangoes. the waffle was perfectly cooked - a nice crunch on the outside and super fluffy on the inside. the fruit was so fresh and perfectly ripe. didn't even need any syrup!  the hubby got the breakfast sammich. it must've been good because, before i knew it, it was gone.  the service was great. you can tell it's a family owned and run business. those are the best in my book.  sure, it might be nice to be able to eat these amazing waffles on real dinnerware with real flatware but the paper and plastic products certainly won't keep me from gettin my WaffleS on!

Thank you, Yelpers for this recommendation. Downtown Vegas was not fulfilling my craving for fresh waffles, but this was perfect since we were on our way to Red Rock and back to LA. We had the waffle breakfast sandwich and the waffle breakfast bowl. Both were really good! Not sure what the sweet sauce was (not maple syrup), but it was just right! Salty potato chips served on the side- I wasn't into that for breakfast.   Not sure if there are usually two people working, but you can tell it's a small business and they work hard to make this place full of quality and definitely unique! I wanted to try everything on the menu, especially all the fruit and ice cream waffles!

This place is super cute. The servers are very sweet and friendly. Like another yelper state, it is not a restaurant. You place your order at the register, seat yourself and they bring your food out. I always get the breakfast combo, which is very reasonably priced for what you get. Portion size is just right, not huge and just enough. I feel as if the waffles are a bit in the salty side, which is probably because the same batter makes both the sweet and savory waffles. Also, try their smoothies.  Huge selection of flavors.

Second time visiting this place and both times were delicious. We ordered a grilled chicken sandwich and a turkey club; the sandwiches came with a choice of chips, waffle fries, or hash browns... we chose the waffle fries. The meal was delicious and well priced at $6.95 (did not order drinks, water was available by condiments counter).  There's a huge menu on the wall; it can look intimidating so just grab a menu near the register if you need extra time. I love that the first items on the menu are desserts; they deserve their place, front and center!

BANG FOR THE BUCK MEETS CREATIVE FUN! I totally love WaffleS Cafe and would give it 4.5 stars if I could. It's not a five star restaurant, but what it is is a great place to go for a fast, well cooked breakfast meal.  WaffleS Cafe is where "Bang for the Buck" meets "Creative Fun!" The BREAKFAST SPECIAL is a full-sized waffle, two eggs to order, bacon or sausage, and coffee is included. (7-11am) All that for $4.99. The coffee included really makes a difference as it'll run you about $2 at most breakfast locations. Additionally, they give it to you in sturdy to-go cups so you can take a cup of coffee with you. Nice!  But the real fun part is you can create the waffles any way you want, and there are a LOT of ingredients to choose from. The fruit toppings run the full range. Along with the standards (including FRESH strawberries) are pineapple and kiwi. Other toppings include peanutbutter, sprinkles, ice cream(!), and a selection of nuts. But there's many, many more toppings and you can mix and match them any way you want. The pricing of the toppings is very fair so you can get several and still be way under the normal breakfast price.  A cool concept is they do some odd toppings as well. For example, they have several pizza waffles (including a supreme). They also have lunch meats for waffle sandwiches. I haven't had them, but the quality of everything that we've had so far has been very good so I suspect it would be the same on these interesting choices.  Jeff and Yooni run the place and I suspect they own it, too. They are always there and you can tell they really want to do a good job. It's awesome seeing them put their heart into the business and it makes me happier to support their effort.  The atmosphere is basic but clean and not too crowded. You won't wait for a table and we get our food rather quickly.  Oh, and they do have smoothies and serve boba (a Vietnamese drink that is sweet like a melted smoothie but has very large tapioca balls in the bottom. Kids love them!)  If you're in the West-Southwest (Ft. Apache just south of Trop) and are looking for something different, fun, CHEAP, yummy, and no wait, I'd check this place out. It's a good one to have in your hip pocket.

5 stars is for the warm and friendly feel. Stopped in for lunch because we were in the neighborhood. Been meaning to try this place cause we pass by it often enough.   The shopping center is questionable. There are only 3 restaurants occupying the property, yet every window has signs of new-coming restaurants moving in. I think there was 8 other restaurant signs and all under construction. So random b/c my bf's lived there for 1.5 yrs and its been an empty plaza.   Tried the waffle sandwich w/ bacon, ham, cheese, and advocado. It was really good! There was a slight sweetness in the waffles(?) which made the sandwich sweet and salty. Bf ordered the grilled chicken sandwich, it was good but mine was so much better. I really want to try their sweet waffles but we were hungry for lunch not dessert.. that just means must return soon!!   The restaurant was open and big. The guy who greeted and took our order was really pleasant. Gave me free coffee! The menu was small and simple easy to order. I love finding mom and pops neighborhood restaurants!!!! Overall good experience would def. come back time and time again (:

I love the tuna sandwich. I'm a regular here and I always ask the worker to add some spiciness to my sandwich. I love it!  Service here is great, feels like you're their best friends. I would recommend this place for anyone who wants a good breakfast that can be turned into a dessert or dinner.  Ask for the Alexa Special. ;)

Came here wanting a real breakfast it fell short.  I ended up getting a tuna waffle which was lacking tuna, too much waffle and not enough meat/flavor.  The Mrs. thought it was "ok" but I don't think we would come back unless to try a dessert waffle.

Waffle Cafe is amazing! The two guys that work in here are very friendly and always provide great service. The food is incredible and unique. We don't have anything else like this in Las Vegas, at least not in the Centennial area for all I know.  Portions are great, food is amazing, service is on point. You can't go wrong with this place.

My husband ordered the chicken sandwich and he described it like eating sugar and chicken that was microwaved.. disgusting. The waffles are paper thin like they are trying to save batter. I wouldn't recommend this place.

Just got out from grubbing on brunch with the fam. We all had the $6.99 waffle breakfast which included 1 waffle, 2 eggs and choice of 2 bacon strips or 1 sausage. We all literally had the same thing: waffle, over medium eggs, bacon. And everything was consistently cooked perfectly to order. The waffles came with a great amount of butter snack dab on the middle. They were crispy and soft in certain areas with a naturally light sweet flavor on their own. The syrup comes room temperature and they also offer strawberry and boysenberry syrup on the counter. The bacon strips were thinner, FYI for those who like thicker cuts. BUT they were crispy and a good meat to fat ratio. No issues with the eggs, at all. This was a second visit here and from what I can remember from before... it was just as yummy! The breakfast also came with unlimited coffee. I love that there's a punch card here, as well! I've filled up my card on this visit and am up for $5 off for the next visit. Deff comin back!

mmm waffles. Wait, is that a breakfast sandwich? But with a waffle instead on bread? Perfect match! Had to try it. And it was good. They had some house sauce on it that was sweet but interestingly nice.  And we also got their choclate strawberry waffle thing. Can't go wrong with this combination. Yum.  There are so many choices of waffles and some pretty interesting ones. Did I mention I love waffles? I need to try all the varieties, but only had room for 2 different waffles to share with the bf.  When we went here for a late breakfast, it was pretty quiet. Only 2 other people inside from what I remember. But as we sat waiting for our food and eating it, there was decent traffic of people ordering waffles to go. It is nice that they have different flavored batters for their waffles.  Must say, the idea of this place is great. Almost a dream come true. And though the waffles were yummy, they were not superb. It did have a different flavor from the traditional waffle and healthier? And a nice place to just sit and chat...It is a place I would return with my waffle cravings. Since it is pretty close to my house.

I went to the waffle cafe with my boyfriend on a monday. i was really quiet. no one was in there so i was able to get my waffle very fast. ( i just ordered strawberries and white chocolate chips )   The place is nice and quaint. they also have boba teas for my boba fans out there! and its really good for kids and families!  i'll be back soon ! :)

The cafe is small but pretty clean. We had issues with the iPad type payment system and ended up paying cash when our credit card payment wouldn't produce a receipt twice. I tried to order a boba tea as an upgrade to my breakfast order but I was told by the cashier I couldn't do that, though the menu on the wall states it's possible. The food is served on paper plates with plastic utensils brought out by the staff calling your name from your receipt. The bacon I received was rather crispy, almost burnt but the eggs were fluffy and delicious. The waffles were crispy and tasty and they offer a variety of warm syrup. The orange juice was rather sweet but good. All in all, we enjoyed our experience and will be back.
Thai tea was terrible, no flavor and watery with the boba balls being hard jelly like and not cooked properly. Milk tea was sour with boba balls also jelly like and not chewy.

OMG! I have driven by this place seance they have opened and have always wanted to try this place.  I'm so glad I went today. I got a waffle breakfast sandwich. It was amazing!! I don't typically like waffles, but these were so light and fluffy and perfect!!!!! I def. Found my new place for breakfast!!!!

keep up the great work, because whatever you're doing with this place is noteworthy. I was greeted sincerely when I walked in. She asked if I wanted to look at the menu myself or have her brief me. Smoothies are authentic, tenders aren't greasy and taste good too. Whatever this dip is for my strips is lit. Strawberry butter for my waffle, and the blueberry syrup is light on weight but prominent on flavor. My son met a new friend here and immediately turned into a play date. Got my stamp card started, and we'll be back without a doubt.
Not enough food for a chipmunk...and what did come was...meh.  Breakfast of last resorts.

This cute little place is amazing. I took my gf there for date night after we played mini golf down the street and we weren't sure what to expect. When we walked in, we were greeted warmly and decided to split a sandwich item and a dessert item.   We ordered the turkey waffle sandwich with bacon and it came sandwiched between a nice delicious crispy, but light, waffle and some type of light sauce with avocao,e lettuce, and tomato. AAHHMAAYYYYZING!!! Seriously. Delicious and impressive. At this time we also ordered a mango boba tea smoothie which was the best I've had in Vegas, even better than tea station in china town!  Next...we ordered Jeff's favorite...which was a pumpkin waffle with apple pie filling, Carmel sauce, vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. We added white chocolate chips. Tasted like heaven. That's all i have to say.   If you have a sweet tooth and you enjoy waffles, check this place out. The two people working there are awesome. The food is amazing and he vibe is mellow. Highly recommended!!!

Best tasting waffles that I have had anywhere. For $7.56 you get a waffle, 2 eggs and tasty sausage.  You order at the counter and they deliver the food to your table. The friendly staff are quick and are always smiling. You have got to check out this place.

Went here with family recently for breakfast based on good reviews.  It is a very simple place, with several tables and a counter where you order.  Basically you look at the big waffle based menu on the wall and seat yourself and wait for your order.  There is a good selection of waffle types, such as chocolate, pumpkin, flax, and regular, and a wide variety of toppings you can pay to add.  There are also waffle pizzas and waffle sandwiches, so make no mistake, waffles are the focus here.   Our experience was not exactly stellar.  We were 4, and ordered and sat down.  The silverware is plastic silverware and paper plates, which is not exactly the most convenient way to eat a meal, if one has ever gone picnicking.  We ordered 3 waffles, and a side of eggs and a sausage.  It took 57 minutes to receive.  FIFTY SEVEN minutes.  The place was moderately full, but not a single person came in after us.  The food itself was not bad, but it was not sensational either.  It was basic waffles that one could make at home, with some scarce toppings put on top ($.50 for a dollop of whipped cream and another $.50 for 3 strawberries sliced up).  The eggs were just simple scrambled eggs.  Now, while the food did not turn me off, it did nothing to instill me with a burning desire to return, and after a near HOUR long wait for what should have taken 10 minutes tops, I will not be back.  The guy at the counter tossed us a couple of $5 coupons, but it came when they brought us the food, and there was nothing said in the intervening hour.  No "hey sorry it is taking an eternity...this is why..." or anything of the sort.  Overall, I give it 2 stars since the food itself was acceptable, and I like to reserve 1 stars for places that are utterly disgusting.

The waffles here "ROCK"!!  Light and fluffy, the perfect breakfast!!  Crunchy on the outside, the inside, almost like eating air.  The breakfast special included scrambled eggs done just right.  Very mom and pop atmosphere, which lends to the charm of the Waffles Cafe, along with the great staff.   This is a go-out-of my-way place!!!

A quick review.  A small Ma & Pa-style breakfast joint.  It's located in a little strip mall with inexpensive furnishings and food is served on paper plates/cups with plastic utensils. It might be time for them to do a little touch up painting in the dining room too.  Don't expect much other than some decent and inexpensive food. I do need to comment that the waffles were REALLY good, despite the spartan layout. Another plus is they offer a 10% military discount.   The young men working there were pleasant and helpful in aiding us in a menu selection.  You go direct to the counter and order and they bring the food to you at your selected table.   The tables we sat at had both been cleared, but not wiped down, which is probably not a good idea considering that waffle syrup is a staple condiment. Breakfast included unlimited coffee refills, but you need to go get it yourself.   FYI, they do not have a soft drink dispenser, so if you order a Coke, they will bring a can and a cup of ice...kinda like they do in Europe.   All in all, not an unpleasant exoerience, but we'll keep searching for a North Las Vegas breakfast favorite. Can't for the life of me figure out how anyone could rate this a 5 star...NEVER.
This is a great spot in Aliante. My favorite time is the breakfast sandwich with waffle fries. Everything always comes out hot and fresh and the staff is always pleasant.

Best food, amazing friendly service. If you've ever had a genuine belgian waffle you know this is the only place to get one in town. The owners treat everyone like best friends. We always feel so welcome!

Packed on weekend mornings, but always friendly fast service. Great tasting breakfast special with coffee for 5.49. This place is small so seating can be an issue at busy times. My only gripe is the floor looks like it needs a good scrubbing.

Overall, great experience.  I ordered an iced chai tea and a pumpkin waffle with raspberries, strawberries, blueberries and light on the whipped creme.  I loved my waffle!  The pumpkin batter was absolutely delicious and the fruit were so fresh!  Definitely not the soggy, miserable little fruit IHOP puts on their fruity-tooty pancakes.  I proceeded to have a conversation with the guy at the register, turns out he's one of the co-owners.  He was a great guy.  He explained to me that they used to have high school kids work there but then they started reading bad reviews on them mentioning customer service so now he works there all the time.  I love that!  He cares about what us customers have to say.  So heads up to anyone that might've had a bad customer service situation with them in the past.  I went on a weekday morning and there was only one group of people in there before me.  The lady of that group put 2 dollars in the tip jar and thanked the co-owner specifically for the customer service and said she loved her food.  It's not often you find a breakfast place that isn't a typical waiter restaurant-style.. so this is a great alternative if you don't have the time for all that.
Went here the first time yesterday. Customer service was good. I had banana split and hot coffee. It was good. Unlimited hot coffee :)  I'll be back to try other stuff.

I've seen some mixed reviews about this place and being how I am, I have to go see for myself. We thought we'd stop by on our way to running some errands and give it a shot. The place is pretty small so you want to get there at a good time so you can actually get a seat. The line can get long at times. We ordered our food and found a seat. It took a long time for us to even get our food. It felt like people who came in after us, were getting their food before us and we only had two in our party. Definitely wasn't happy about waiting as long as we did for our food. I got the chicken and waffle plate and he got the ice cream sundae waffle. They were both good, but I don't think they were super. I will say the strawberry butter that they give you for the chicken and waffle didn't go very well. I'm glad I only put it on half of my waffle. I won't do that again. The sundae waffle was good too, but it was super sweet to eat for breakfast. We may go back and try it again, trying something different on their menu.

I think a good gauge for how good a restaurant is, is when everybody in your party finishes everything on their plate (without being threatened). I would say for us (me, wifey & 2 kids) this doesn't happen often, although we eat out a lot. We stopped here on the way up to Red Rock Canyon. We ordered the Breakfast Special (son),  a Breakfast Sandwich (me), Yooni's Favorite (daughter) & a Banana Split (wifey). Everything was delicious and satisfying. Now only if they could get some fried chicken up in the mix.

Waffles were great! I had the blazing chicken & waffle sandwich I highly recommend it!  Would have again.  You can tell the waffles were made Fresh. The coffee was delicious, strong. The wait staff was very nice, and attentive.

Excellent:  food (quality,price, portion size,variety of menu offerings) cleanliness of establishment decorum,tables and chairs spacing is adequate, customer service, price. There are healthy conscious offerings to include gluten free, organic, vegan. Kudos to Kim

I give the WC 4 stars total. I love waffles. And the place is clean and everyone is kind. This is a nice little spot to sit and have breakfast. On a Saturday morning when IHOP is packed to the max. You can enter here and get served in less than 15 minutes. Even if your in a large group. The eggs they cook are the best ever. And the place is extra clean. Water is free. Wait for it....Oh my they give you a large cup! This place is worthy of my business. I will bring friends and family here, It wont break yo bank. I had a waffle eggs and bacon for like 5 bucks. This is helpful around the holiday time when you just want to run in get fed and head out to do holiday shopping!
Amazing food that was ready on time and warm friendly staff,love this place I definitely recommend it to all my friends and family

Love this place so much. Now that I have a Yelp account, I can finally leave a review. Everything about this place and especially the food is so great. The food is wholesome, fresh, and local. Everything was made perfectly. I usually order the pumpkin waffles breakfast with walnuts. To die for! The staff is very attentive and very friendly. Jeff is such a sweet guy!

What a great option for us, Gluten Free waffles and you can get any type of waffle that they way. A great selection for breakfast and lunch. A definite stop when we're here, great job and great food!!

We went here after purchasing a Groupon.  It was really busy and the servers had a hard time keeping up, lots of dirty tables.  We had to clean our own!  The whole place was really dirty - stains on the walls and the floors were disgusting. If we had noticed that before we ordered we wouldn't have stayed.  The food was good, I liked the waffles but I want to eat in a clean restaurant.

I stopped in  the Waffles Cafe for a bite to eat before heading home and boy I'm happy I did. The two gentlemen at the counter recommended many items but I chose something simple since it was my first time trying the place out. I ordered one Waffle, scrambled eggs and a sausage link. My order arrived at the table and might I say my Waffle couldn't of smell better. After taking my first bite  I was hooked. My Waffle taste so lite not heavy like the others,the butter was melted evenly on my Waffle and they have so many options of syrup to choose from its unreal. The scrambled Eggs were perfect not hard and the Sausage link, well it was a sausage link, but good. I will definitely go back for more you can bet on that. This cafe was clean, the service was fast and l highly recommend this place. Aw

First time experience was delicious. I ordered chicken and waffle and it was such a nice combo. Love the strawberry whipped butter with the spicy sauce! The chicken taste ok but wish it was more tender and juicy. Waffles were perfect. Went back another time and tried to order the same thing for dinner but they ran out of chicken. Went back 3rd day but they were already closed so I suggest getting meat entree early in the day. Would be nice if they extended their hours in the evening . I thought the prices were a little high tho.
Great service, excellent food, and affordable. Very personable staff who recognizes repeat customers.

I like trying new places, particularly those in sad little strip malls that I fear are going to go tits up in this economy.  When I went to Waffles Cafe I thought I would be doing them some kind of charity - nay!  There were so many people at the cafe that it was standing room only for awhile.  That's okay because the walls are so brightly painted that you can't help but feel happy and okay with waiting around for your waffle.  The place is so tiny and overcrowded which is one reason they didn't get 5 stars, but the reason for the popularity is because of the great grub!  My first thought was that they didn't have enough food on the menu with protein because I was in the mood for a good egg dish (duh!  then why did I go to a place descriptively named 'waffles'?!), but then I got a load of the Waffle Sandwich.  This baby is, again, descriptively named.  Instead of bread, they make this sandwich with waffles that are sweet and syrupy, but with savory fillings.  I had ham and bacon with avocado and tomato inside of my sweet waffle bread.  It was nothing if not freakin' delicious!  Messy, but delicious.  Next time, and there will be a next time, I will try the tuna waffle sandwich.  It does sound disgusting, but I am strangely attracted...  stay tuned.  My only complaints were the very uncomfortable and cheap seats and tables and the lack of space, but otherwise a lovely breakfast.
Tasty food. Clean location. Great customer service. Friendly and quick. We will be returning for there chicken and waffles. Thank you Waffles Cafe!
Absolute worst breakfast ever. I can't think of another restaurant I have ever been that I would give one star. Just inedible, and I eat everything.

waffles are great. who dosnt like a menu based carbs!!   if they would just take the concept from the signage and pull it thru the whole place it would be much more pleasant to be inside, for now stay focused on the food and you'll come back over and over...  nutella, banana, strawberry and whipped cream on a fresh hot amazing waffle...   my mouth watering now just thinking of it... ENJOY!!

The food was decent but the problem was that the chicken tenders I got weren't actually tenders. A chicken tender is technically part of the breast. The breast being made of the pectoralis major and minor. The pectoralis major is the "breast" part. The smaller section of the breast is the pectoralis minor, or the "tender". What I got wasn't that. It was a glorified chicken nugget. Processed, spongey, and all.  My tip to the establishment: don't call giant nuggets "tenders".  Other than that, the food was decent. Good luck.  Update: I finished my coffee and it was super grainy at the end. Bitter bits of grounds got me grumpy. BAD!!!

Thanks yelp for this find! This place has some outstanding waffles which you can get in breakfast combos, or sandwiches, or however you like.  Stop on by here when you get tired of the Vegas buffets and want something a llttle different.

I give this place five stars!!!!  Service is great and professional, the waffles  delicious!!  The eggs bacon sausage and hashbrowns were excellent!! They have a very large and the licious menu I can't wait to go back and try something different!! If you're ever in the area centennial I recommend stopping in having a bite..
One of my favorite spots to eat breakfast! The owners are so polite as well!! They hired more staff and all we have come across have been amazing and so nice!! Love this place

The waffles are sooo good you can't eat just one.   The food is outstanding and even though you eventually become full you still want more.  The menu has  many selections and is very easy to read.  Larry & Eva Roth

This is a pretty cool idea for a restaurant. Different and delicious! I had the s'mores waffle and it was really good. The only think is you pay for the waffle and that's it. I'd like it if they already had premade combo meals. Maybe I missed it but I like how things are set together.    I will go back for sure! Great little treat every now and then.

I love this place!!! They have a very unique menu which isn't just limited to traditional breakfast.   They have really yummy ice cream selections as well as more hearty selections...  The people who own this place are very friendly and always have a smile on their face, they are also very accommodating!   I love their waffles they are so unique I would describe the taste as sort of like a sweet croissant like taste, and a light  fluffy and crisp texture, not heavy like your traditional waffle.Also the milkshakes are my sons Fav!!!   I also love their loyalty cards. The overall setting is casual but still family friendly.

Today we brought a friend from out of town to this place because we liked it so much last time we went there.  It turned out to be a complete disappointment.  We had to get the food to go because the friend had a plane to catch.  The guy told us it would take 10 to 15 mins for the food to be ready.  We waited.  While we were waiting, everyone else got served, even people that came to the place AFTER us.  After 20+ mins, there was no sign of the food, I asked the guy and told him that we were in a hurry.  He said "it should be ready in 4 mins." (his exact words).  10 mins passed... no food.  I don't even know how long we ended up waiting for 3 waffles.  Finally the food was here, they were questioning us what we ordered.  At that point I was just furious.  Right, took you forever to get our food because you served everyone else first and now you are telling me that you don't remember what we ordered?! I will NEVER go back. NEVER. EVER.

Amazing customer service. Employee came out and walked us through the menu and gave us tips and suggestions. Waffles were yum. I had banana and peanut butter. My husband had a blazing chicken sandwich. Fries were awesome, too. Out of the rush of town. We'll definitely be back!

We were craving a waffle and had not tried out this spot. Smells wonderful when you come in, definitely waffles being cooked up. However, it was just ok, meaning we ate it but won't bother coming back. I tried the pumpkin waffle which really didn't taste anything close to pumpkin. They also placed a huge wad of butter on it which should have been on the side as I don't care for butter. It should be the customers choice to add it. My honey tried a pizza version which was fine, but not a stand out.

I've lived by here for almost 8 months and I finally came in and oh my gosh! I've fell in love! It taste so good and satisfied my breakfast craving! I love the potato scramble. I'll defiantly be recommending my friends :)

Waffles were solid. Crispy and golden brown on the outside light and airy on the inside. The dessert ingredient combos were heavenly.  I also had a sandwich waffle which was tasty. I might recommend using a better quality meat and larger portion. The secret sauce was tasty, kind of a sweet mayo. Service was friendly but we were the only ones inside.

I only decided to eat at this restaurant due to its good ratings on Yelp... I was disappointed to find that the food was sub-par. I thought I would be having some magically delicious waffle... I did not find it to be magical at all. The waffles are big and somewhat tasty. I think it's the butter, not the syrup, that makes it good. The supreme pizza waffle was a bore... I didn't bother to finish it. I was happy to find that they had boba drinks (odd for a waffle place, right?), but noticed they were pricier than my favorite standalone boba location. It was $4.50 for a large Thai tea w/ boba. Again, it only tasted okay. (I would gladly pay $5 for super tasty boba.) Even though I received a stamp card, I won't be coming back here.

So you won't believe how I ended up here. Somehow I had it in my head that the Wild Wild West was the hidden gem of Vegas buffets. Well, when Jamie W. and I drove there, we discovered that it was a tired motel filled with frog-voiced smokers next to a Denny's. Surely my mind was playing tricks on me. As I realized much later, it was Sam's Town I was looking for, but regardless, we were jonesing for breakfast. Thanks to the trusty Yelp app on my iPhone, we zeroed in on WaffleS Cafe.   Surprise, surprise...it's in a strip mall just like almost every non-Strip eatery in town. It really looks like a smoothie shop since I couldn't tell if they even had a kitchen. The overhead menu would have you believe it's a virtual waffle-palooza in there. Perhaps but I didn't hear the sound of a griddle or the plop of the batter, which made me think the waffles are made elsewhere and heated up in the back. It was just too quiet in there. Anyhow, both of us went for the $5.49 Breakfast Special - which consisted of a large, round waffle; a couple of eggs; bacon or sausage; and a cup of coffee.   I ordered the pumpkin waffle and had blueberries and whipped cream placed on top. It was good, and the meaty sausage and scrambled eggs helped a lot. Jamie showed greater forbearance and had his pumpkin waffle plain with a pat of butter, but he weakened and went for the bacon. All in all, it didn't feel substantive enough to be the breakfast we desired, but it did tie us over until the dogs we had at Pink's for lunch. Not because of the server, who was quite nice and cheery, but I doubt if I'll be back simply because it is slipping from my memory as I write this.   FOOD - 3 stars...nice large Belgian-style waffles but the oomph factor seemed missing  AMBIANCE - 3 stars...surely they sell Jamba Juice here, don't they?  SERVICE - 4 stars...peppy and responsive  TOTAL - 3 stars...just not quite memorable enough for me to return for a waffle
Just absolutely amazing this food. Had the waffles with apple pie topping.. Taste so good! Excellent service
The waffles are great, but you have to try the tuna sandwich where they use waffles as the bread! On top of that, their bobs teas hit the spot.

Thank you Yelp for another Yelp recommended find.  I tried this place because of Yelp and was not disappointed.  I got the Chicken and Waffles as recommended by the server.  It was delice....  Now, the space is not much in the way of ambiance. It is the typical strip mall food spot with seats, spartan look and feel and pretty clean.  But the waffle types and combinations and the bubble tea's make this spot worth a special visit.    If they upgraded their establishment and made it a bit more fun/creative/upscale, this could then be a 5 star....

I took my husband for a quick brunch on father's day. At first the inside is not much to look at, tables and chairs and menu on the wall. Once you get past the presentation of the cafe you realize what they have to offer is a clean eatery with unique menu.  Waffles offer a lighter alternative to bread or buns on their sandwiches. I was very pleased with the taste of the food. We will definitely be going back. The service was very good
Waffles very little and hot!!! Nicely ran, and great selection of waffles, and coffee!!! Fun great idea....

Seriously love this place! We've been here a couple times on the weekend and have loved coming here. Everyone is so friendly and the food is good! I'm not a huge breakfast person but even I can't turn down their waffles. For me though it's the customer service. Everyone is just happy and helpful. I will keep comin here for sure!

My husband and I love this place! Every time we are in town to visit family this is our first stop ! We are obsessed with their tuna waffle sandwiches! AMAZING!! And I can't forget to mention their boba teas! Love love love this place! The owners along with their awesome sons are extremely friendly and always have a smile on their faces!

Oh Waffles Cafe, I really wanted you to be amazing but I left disappointed, only eating a few bites of my meals that I paid over $20 for. I literally left the food to go eat somewhere else. I was super excited to eat here too because there have been some many five star reviews. I'm leaving two stars because the restaurant was clean and the staff was kind but I was not a fan of my meal at all.   When we walked in we were greeted warmly and I was getting hungry right away. The restaurant is a cute little mom & pop type business with 15 or so table tops and a smaller breakfast bar against the window. The first odd thing I noticed when I walked in was that even after being greeted by the staff behind the counter I wasn't sure if I should seat myself, wait to be seated, or walk to the counter and order.   I could go down the road of pointing out the things I didn't like about our meal, but instead I feel that some constructive criticism might be helpful:   1. The menu is laid out funk and it was hard for me to follow along. It took me a few minutes to figure out what in the heck was going on. I like the idea that you can build your own waffle but making toppings all different prices had me scratching my head. I had no idea what I was spending.....just blindly ordering and I wasn't a fan.   2. The fruit in the fresh fruit did not taste fresh. Mostly it was the bananas that stood out to me. An old banana has a very distinct taste, and I wasn't excited about it. At first glance it looked amazing, but I couldn't say the same after I tasted it. The fruit wasn't cut into nice pieces, it was chopped into lots of smaller pieces that seemed odd. Lets call it more like a diced fruit bowl.   3. We received our meal at different times.
