That gets Waffles a bonus star from me!  The food is yummy too.  On this visit I had the chicken & waffle.  It was really good.  It was different than I have ever had it before, so that was fun.  The waffles here are the size of the plate they come on and are of the thinner variety.  The waffle batter has something special in it, but I can't quite figure it out.  I think it is vanilla and maybe cinnamon?  I'm not sure, but they are yummy.  The chicken of the dish was 3 chicken fingers.  They tasted good, but weren't anything special.  What made the dish different was that it came with strawberry butter and a spicy hot sauce to go with the food.  The sweet, fruity butter went great with the food and I would order that on any waffle any time!  The spicy, thick, hot sauce was an interesting flavor and actually went well with the sweetness of the butter.  I know it sounds strange, but it really worked.   If you are into dessert style waffles, this is your place as well.  The have all sorts of options like apple pie filling, chocolate, pumpkin, strawberry, and a lot more to satisfy your sweet tooth.  They actually have more dessert varieties than breakfast and savory dishes.  YUMMY!  If you are into fancy teas like Thai, Boba, or Fruit teas, then you are REALLY in luck since they have about 3 dozen or tea varieties to make your taste buds happy.    I think the prices are a bit high for what you get, which is why I dropped them in the score.  The entree waffles all seem about a $1-2 too high for what you actually receive.  If the prices were a bit less, I would be at Waffles a lot more for sure.

ONE JOB GUYS. U make waffles and Bfest crap. Its super simple!!!! Why isnt your ENTIRE MENU ON GRUB HUB???????? Called to place the order instead, but I cant trust that because you FORGOT part of my order last time. Even tho you repeated it OVER THE PHONE. Its not rocket science!

Comment dire...  OH MON DIEU !  De tout les repas (de porcs) faits à Vegas (baby !), c'est à ceux au WaffleS Café que je repense le plus.  Des gaufres énormes, délicieuses, mais surtout légères, plein de recettes de pâtes au choix (normal, complet, avoine, chocolat, potiron...) et des dizaines de combinaisons possibles vu tout les toppings disponibles : noix de pécans (beurk), beurre de cacahuètes, nutella, compote de pommes, noix de coco, amandes, mini-marshmallows, pépites de chocolat, sauce caramel, sauce chocolat ET PLEIN DE FRUITS FRAIS (rien que d'y repenser je pleure un peu à l'intérieur).  Y'a aussi plein d'autres trucs sur la carte, mais vaut mieux garder la place pour manger des gaufres, parce qu'elles dépotent du tonnerre.   Ah et oui, j'ai oublié de parler du prix : environ 7$ pour une double gaufre avoine avec deux fruits et deux toppings, ça veut dire environ 4,50 pour s'en mettre plein la panse. Miam.  WaffleS Café I love you.
The service is outstanding, and I love all the different toppings! The lime infused water was a nice touch, too. Will definitely go again!
Always good and clean. These people work there butt off and are so happy day n and day out! It's always been the same since day one! This is a sit in kind of place. Eat it while it's fresh!!
This visit was much better than my first. Service was fast, staff was friendly and food was cooked perfect!  I had the waffle pizza and it was delicious.

After being referred to  Waffles cafe by an employee from an adjacent business, I gave the place a try. Boy am i glad we did. The customer service was attentive and helped with the menu items. The place was clean and well staffed.  We ordered the chicken and waffles and the tropic thunder plate.  The best waffle I've ever had. It was light and fluffy and mines came with a strawberry butter, no need for syrup.  However, I used syrup on the waffles anyway. I will come back and order a la carte and make my meal more health conscious. I real breakfast treat.

My boyfriend and I were yelping Breakfast places and came across this place and decided to give it a try. The pictures and menu options sold us Lol. We are sooooo glad we found this place! Service was excellent by a guy named Jeff who recommended to try the Waffle Sandwich. We got the Ham & Bacon...mmmm best waffle sandwich we've ever had! We also had Yooni's Favorite which was strawberries, bananas, whipped cream, ice cream, and chocolate sauce all on top of a warm, soft, crispy on the outside waffle. Their waffles were a perfect texture and wasn't soggy at all. Everything was delicious, we will definitely come back to this place when we come to Vegas again.

So glad we finally made it to Waffles Cafe. I love waffles for breakfast, but was looking forward to trying the dessert waffles that I seen pictured on Yelp. I had the Banana split waffle on a chocolate waffle (delicious). My Dad who doesn't even like waffles had the Pumpkin Waffle with apples and vanilla ice cream. He ate the whole thing and said it was great!! He didn't save me a bite. My waffle was slightly crisp on the outside-light and fluffy on the inside and the warm waffle melted the ice cream perfectly. The bananas were fresh and plentiful. The waffles are bigger that I thought, but we had no problem finishing them off. Service was great and friendly. Looking forward to my next visit.
Amazing little hole in the wall. Customer service was available. Food was better then we thought it would be. We will definitely go back soon.

I ordered the Best Friend waffle and it was decent, crispy and soft in a good way. However, they undoubtedly put spoiled milk in my thai tea with boba! Unfortunately I got my food through Postmates so I couldn't do much complaining with out calling but I was extremely disgusted and will not be returning. Who knows what else is out of date in their store.
The waffles were a complete sugar rush, but they were wonderful. Smoothies were good too.  Service was a bit slow, but they were busy so it's understandable.

The food here was so good. I have the potato scrambles and a side of pancakes. The food came out hot and with a smile. This is not a fancy place, but if you want a great breakfast with good service, this is your place.

This place has amazing smoothies and lots of options. Great place to have breakfast and just relax with friends. The staff is excellent and very friendly. Nice to have a small town feel place in this big city.

If you are craving waffles for breakfast come here!  Cool spot for family/kids, I'd say. My bf really liked it lol and service was great as well. Portions are not huge like other places. Their waffles with chicken cream/sauce were really good. Would come back if I had kids with me :)

I just ate here and it was amazing food was really good  And Ashere was so nice and had amazing customer service  He showed us a break down of the menu he was very enthusiastic I loved how he offered his favorite 's  He asked questions  His service was very authentic!!!!!!

The oat waffle was great!  The waffle sandwich looked great too, but I didn't try that.  The staff did a great job of greeting us with a smile and explaining their menu to us.   Who knew there were so many things to do with a waffle?

Ok, so my friends and I were looking for some breakfast foods after church.  I suggested this place, since it had great reviews on yelp.  Upon entering this place, I was expecting to be seated and to have a menu handed to me. But, no you  have to go up there and order what you want which was ok with me except I did want to stare at the menu while sitting down and reading a description.  But it's ok, I can deal.    Let me just say, I was really disappointed with this place.  I didn't understand the whole concept of ordering, or anything.  And even though the guy explained it to us, he made it seem like we could only order the breakfast portion even though I wanted to try the waffle pizza. I ended up ordering the Yooni's Favorite, which was no favorite of mine.  It didn't really grab my attention, and the waffles is ordinary.  The waffles were kind of pricey; and everything's served on paper plates and disposable utensils which I found kind of "ghetto." I don't know that's just me.   The drive wasn't worth it, I might've just drove more down for babycakes.  At least their place had flavor, and prices are well worth it.

Five years later this Waffles Cafe still maintains the high quality and consistency of food and service that's earned my family's loyalty. Of the two locations this one is the best, by far. Waffles are crisp and airy, the staff is super friendly, and parking is a breeze.   We always order the tuna waffle sandwich with hash browns during breakfast time or chips during lunchtime. Runs about $7 per person and always hits the spot.  Still a loyal customer!

I'm a hard reviewer when it comes to 5 stars, but this place comes close. The waffles themselves are delicious, nice and lightly crispy on the outside and soft and flavorful on the inside. I could eat a waffle by itself. The toppings are good and fresh, it's just that to get what you want on the waffle, the price will pile up high very quickly. If you order their personal favorites (two of them), you'll save more money.  BUT LET ME TELL YOU THE GEM OF THIS PLACE-- THE WAFFLE SANDWICH. I've only had the tuna waffle sandwich but it changed my life. It's a large waffle folded in half stuffed with tuna, fresh greens, and a questionable clear and delicious sauce (sweet) that goes really well with the sandwich. Comes with a side of ridged potato chips and runs around 6.55 a sandwich. All in all, not bad.  If you're in a hurry though, CALL AHEAD and pick up your food because it does take a while to make and my mom and I were growing restless on their uncomfortable but trendy dining chairs.  The inside is really nicely decorated with bright oranges and lime greens. I felt like I had died and been reincarnated as a citrus fruit.
Very friendly and nice to first timers. I ordered strawberry waffle with choco chips and apple pie filling, it was so tasty I didn't need syrup! Def coming back to try more!

Good waffles; weird sandwiches. Although the waffles here are pretty good, the sandwiches they make (using waffles as bread) are just weird. Whether chicken, turkey or ham sandwiches they use sweet waffles as bread plus this sugary "secret sauce" that really doesn't work well with meats. Very friendly atmosphere and staff, but if you want something more than waffles go somewhere else.

So so surprised the waffles were the perfect marriage of subtle sweet light waffle batter and the savory of a turkey sandwich. This was my cheat meal of the week and so beyond worth it.   Little strawberry sauce on top of the yumminess. Lovely family run (there must be a super mom in the back who could make a porcupine taste good) and will be back.   FYI. I don't know how late this spot is open but after a night of drinking too much, it beats the shorts off Taco Hell & Jack n the Crack for alcohol-absorbing delight.
Not sure why this place has a four star rating? Waffle sandwich was dry and without flavor. If you want a delicious waffle, visit the Coffee Pub instead.

I wanted to turn around and walk out as soon as the grease trap smell hit me in the face. That has to be the worst smell on the planet. The eggs were fine and the bacon was cheap... the waffles weren't bad but it was hard to enjoy with the strong smell of grease floating through the air. The worst part is they used paper plates and plastic forks and cups. I spent $34 to be served off plastic... and what about the environment??? They're obviously not recycling because you can't recycle anything that's soiled. The amount of money they probably spend on plastic-wear they could probably invest in some actual dishes and glass-wear. The coffee was the best part and they were very nice but I won't support a business that doesn't consider the environment.

So accommodating! I'm vegan and going out can be a challenge, well after only a few questions, waffles café created me a vegan sandwich! They sautéed peppers, mushrooms and olives added some lettuce and tomatoes on wheat bread. So delicious... I added a little mustard for zing and it was perfect. The entire staff was so nice, it was truly a pleasure and I hope they didn't find me too picky.   ALSO, they will sub almond milk for yogurt in their smoothies! I had the lychee flavor. They have an incredible amount of flavors. Go check it out!

Stopped in for brunch. Chicken and Waffles, Turkey Club, Blazing Chicken, the Cherry Blossom were on the ticket and they all certainly satisfied! Waffle cut fries were excellent and the tornado fries will be tried the next time out- All menu items were under $10- Staff very cheery and helpful. Absolutely no complaints or issues with this strip mall eatery.

This place was a little over priced it smelled like moist towels in the restaurant it was humid inside I wouldn't really ever go back unless they looked a little better and cleaned up whatever that smell was.

When I lived in Aliante this place was my go to for boba tea since other places are quite a drive. I'm glad that their boba tea menu fits my cravings (for more simplistic drinks) especially their milk tea or the lychee smoothie with boba/lychee jelly.   I've had their waffles a couple of times and they're decent. I never make waffles nor do I have anything to make waffles with so this is good when I want it once in a while. I'm partial to sweet versus savory. They do have normal breakfast options if you just want waffles on the side and not dressed up.  Their coffee drinks are also really good!
Nice place, wide variety of waffles to choose for your belly =d

This place is amazing! The food was delicious and the build your own section is impressive. I decided to go with the chicken and waffles and I loved it. They also have a boba tea and smoothie section with multiple flavors. I definitely see myself being a regular.

This is the nearest place for me to buy Boba when I feel like having one. Not bad. It takes a very long time for them to make one shake. I went to Smith's to buy a few things I needed, went back to the cafe and they were not yet done.  Their swirl potato chip on a stick is really good. I think they are over priced. Overall,  I still go there to buy my boba.
Stopped here on the way home from visiting and instantly fell in love. Will be a required stop any time we're in town from now on.
My favorite place for breakfast. They are consistently good and super friendly. They know my order and the prices are reasonable
Good place for breakfast or lunch.  Kids love the kids breakfast.  I've had the adult breakfast and chicken and waffles,  both good. Friendly staff. Lots of choices.

Went here for breakfast and it was amazing! It was my first time and the staff was super friendly and asked if I had been there and gave me tips on what to order! When I got the waffles they were definitely worth it!
The ultimate breakfast bowl is delicious!  Quiet atmosphere for a Sunday morning breakfast.  My best friend & I love coming to this little place
Great little place.  Looks like she has WiFi.  Waffles are very good,  According to my German husband, they are just as good as those he ate in Europe.  Very friendly and good prices.

so due to some crazy impromptu trip to vegas, my friends and I ended up here.  One of my friends that lives in Vegas insisted that we go here, and besides, we'd already seen a picture of her coffee waffle with nutella and bananas, so we were game.  It's quite a bit away from the strip, so if you don't have a car while in Vegas, expect a large cab fare.    Decent prices, options galore.  You pick a type of waffle that you want, and then you can pick from a variety of toppings.  You can also make it a combo, add some potatoes and eggs.    The guy working there is super nice, I think he might be the owner.  He ran through the whole process with us, and remembered that my friend had been there before.  We all got a waffle, two coffees, one pumpkin.  Needless to say, they were only clean plates left.  Definitely worth another visit.

Small shop making waffles with love. The food and shakes do take a few minutes longer than what some of us may be used too but the food is worth the wait. They are not stingy with their portions, food tasted and looked great.   Didn't know whether or not to still put syrup on my waffle sandwich but I did, and it tasted great.   The place was surprisingly quiet, although there were a few different groups of people inside.   Shakes: Good and simple. I was more impressed with the fact that it came with a jumbo straw rather than those other skimpy ones.   Overall a must try if you haven't stopped by.

This place is phenomenal from the food to the drinks to the smoothies to the atmosphere to the music to the friendly workers to the owners themselves I had to get his place 10 out of 10 it is perfect it needs nothing else to be a great place it is beyond perfect I will definitely be going here again I love this place the food is awesome very very very awesome and the drinks are awesome as well I know I said that already but what can I say when something is good do you have to explain it the best you can I will be coming again and again.
Had a choco waffle with strawberries and bananas. It was excellent! I will definitely be coming back.

I had a fantastic meal here. We ordered the tornado fries, blazing chicken sandwhich, flax waffles with coconut and almonds and waffle fries. Everything was excellent but I'm partial to the chicken. The prices were very good, check the menu on yelp and see for yourself. Worth a trip!

Friendly service, we only waited ten minutes (maybe less) for our food.  I had the original waffle, and my friend had a pumpkin waffle.  A little bit of a crispy outside, nice and moist on the inside.  Very tasty.  Eggs on the side were bland, and the turkey sausage was good, but not great.  Coffee was also mediocre.  If you only get waffles it's excellent, but average sides prevent a higher rating.  Next time I go I'll definitely just get a few waffles.

Cute place, I was in the mood for something savory so I got a turkey waffle sandwich.  It comes with tomato, lettuce, avocado, cheese and sauce.  I should've asked what the sauce was before I got it, it was like a sweetened Italian dressing goo, but the waffle instead of bread is a neat concept.  The green iced tea was very grassy and delicious.  It is far away from my side of town so I wouldn't rush back here, but I am sure the sweeter waffles are fun.  I guess I can agree with another yelper that the chairs aren't that comfy but it is a casual place.

I enjoy having breakfast here. They have a variety of waffles breakfast and lunch items. The service is always great. The cafe is always very clean. The owner has been here every visit and is very friendly. Today I had the breakfast sandwich, it was delicious! (Like always) oatmeal was delicious also..!
This place is a dump. Very dirty and grimy. The tables and seats are not clean. The waffles were ok. Nothing special. I would not go here again.

The people that work there are soooooooooooo nice and helpful!  The waffles were decent but I would not go out of my way to get there.  Seemed like they have a lot of regulars though.  I did not like the fact that they do not have any fountain soda.

Saw the reviews before leaving for my Vegas trip and decided to try it out myself. I personally am a huge FAN of WAFFLES. I mean come on, who doesn't love a good waffle? :]  The menu is really simple and not overwhelming like most other places. You can either A) choose your type of waffle and your favorite toppings and sides. B) order a waffle sandwich (DELICIOUS) with your choice of tuna, ham & bacon, chicken, or turkey. C) waffle pizza!! I ordered the Turkey Waffle Sandwich and OMG!! The waffle tasted like any other waffle but the idea of it in sandwich form was on another level. The sauce that they put in the sandwich made it even yummier as well. It's not really mayonnaise, but it's a sweet clear sauce that brought everything in the sandwich together.  If you are in the area definitely check it out.

Our Favorite neighborhood breakfast place!   By far the best waffle.. Crisp on the outside yet light and fluffy inside- and a wonderful taste.  We enjoy the breakfast special and the atmosphere of this family owned restaurant. We are always greeted with a welcome and hello when we come to the counter.  The consistency of quality is one reason we continue to make this our favorite!

Great little place to grab some yummy food! They serve breakfast style waffles, lunch style waffles and smoothies! I enjoyed how they had the option to make your waffle healthier by adding flax seeds, organic, or even adding fresh fruit. I ordered the breakfast special which was a perfect amount of food. There was one waffle, sausage, eggs, and a cup of coffee. My boyfriend ordered the waffle ham sandwich that came with hash browns. They were both delicious!  Very clean and friendly environment. They had today's top hits playing on the radio and the news on the tv. The staff was great and the service was very quick! I will be returning here often. Extremely pleased with this find!

This is a cute little unassuming restaurant in a complex that I have managed to ignore for the longest time. Seriously. I've been to the Wal-Mart and other stores across the road, but I think this is the first time I've ever gone to something on this side of the road.  I ordered the Fruit Sandwich Waffle. It was very good and worth the price of admission. My cousin had a Chocolate Waffle with strawberries and chocolate sauce. Everything was good.  Honestly, I'm not a big waffle fan. In fact, I usually only get them at hotels that have the waffle maker (because it's just fun!). In this case, I'm giving four stars for one simple and silly reason - from the moment I stepped in the door, I heard one Beatles song after another. They eventually played other music (and then more Beatles), but that alone makes me a fan. Well, that and their employees are uber-friendly. It would be a shame if they had great taste in music but were rude.

I'd love to give this café a higher rating because the food was decent, but seeing 50+ typos on their printed menu was a bit unsettling. If management lack this degree of attention to detail, I wonder if they are checking the expiration date on their eggs (not a good first impression). Another issue was the server brought out 2 trays for our food and placed 1 tray onto a neighboring table (where guests were sitting!!) while she served us. MAJOR NO NO! You never place a guests food on another guests table. YIKES! ~ Lastly, the price was high when considering you have to stand to place your order, eat on paper plates and use plastic utensils..oh, can clear your own table. ($30 for 3 waffle orders with no drinks)

Horrible! Husband and I both order chicken wings and waffles. Everything down to the strawberry butter tasted disgusting! The waffles tasted as if they're seasoned with savory spices and the texture was that of a freezer waffle. Chicken was overly salty, the meat smelled and tasted as if the meat had gone bad and they were fried in old oil.  I was only able to get through three bites of the meals before I had to stop because I couldn't stomach anymore. The meal didn't even smell appetizing.  Add TERRIBLE customer service to the list. Just got off the phone with the manager and she was beyond RUDE! Her attitude was completely HORRENDOUS! She yelled and hung up the phone TWICE. Uncourteous and unprofessional.
1st time eating here. The food was not bad, it's a nice place for a lunch break. It kinda feels almost like a nice fast food place, I didn't really feel a cafe vibe....NOT BAD AT ALL:)!!
very good waffles! the menu is huge and everything is on a waffle, from pecans to ham its all on a waffle! a little pr icy but very creative!

The place to be to get Belgian Waffles in Vegas. Been here numerous times, but finally got around to writing a review for this place.  Food: Waffles, Waffles, Waffles. Waffles with strawberries. Waffles with blueberries. Waffles pizza. Waffles with ice cream. They would do waffles boba drink if it was delicious. I think you get the idea. I stick to the original waffles, I'm a purist of taste. The Belgian waffles are just delicious, but really need some ingredients like nuts and berries to really bring out the flavor. I recommend adding some topping. The Waffle Pizza is interesting. I tried the pepperoni waffle pizza. I wouldn't say its bad, but I wouldn't order it again. It certainly is unique. I wish the waffle wasn't so soft, would have tasted a lot better had it been a little crunchy or harder. Sadly, anything that isn't a waffle is meh. Personally I would avoid the $5 breakfast special: waffle, eggs, bacon or sausage, and coffee (before 11am). Eggs were mediocre and bacon was too crispy for my taste.   Service: The staff are really friendly and helpful. Jeff (the owner?) is really friendly and nice. However, service could be faster. On average, I would say it takes 10 minutes to make your waffle from the time of ordering, IF you're the only one there. This place is usually pack so wait time could easily go 20 - 30 minutes. I highly recommend calling your order in right before you leave for this place.  Price: Base price for the waffle is $3.75 which isn't that bad. But here is the clever up selling technique. Pricing the ingredients relatively cheap, under $1. You go a little crazy on ingredients and you're waffle easily goes over $6. Really brilliant on the business end. While the $5 breakfast is a good value, it just doesn't work for me. I rather just spend it on the ingredients and make 1 really good waffle.  Summary: Anything that isn't the traditional waffle just doesn't really work for me. Stick to the traditional waffles and go topping crazy, and you won't be disappointed.

We have been coming to this place for years.  They have awesome waffles.  The rest of the food is ok, but the waffles are crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside.  If you are on this side of town, it is a must.

My family loves this location - it's not far from our house and it makes the children happy. It's family owned so there is a special kind of treatment you receive.  If you support small business and like breakfast this is a definite go spot.

We just moved to the area and wanted to try something new. Im not a huge breakfast person but I was in the mood for something new. Stumbled upon this family business and found a real treat! We ordered the chicken breast sandwich and a turkey breast sandwich n  it was so much better than I could have imagined! It wasn't crazy heavy on the stomach and tickled all of my taste buds. Low cost, delicious, family owned and fresh... hits all the check marks for a new favorite! Will def come back to this place..   P.S. woulda taken pictures of the food but it was too good to wait! :)
It was my wife's birthday so for the second consecutive year we decided to celebrate by dining at Waffles on strawberry pancakes with whipped cream

Great place with great customer service. It gets pretty busy on weekends so plan to arrive early. I recommend the breakfast special for first timers,but the rest of the menu is awesome as well. My family and I love this place and come here often. For those complaining about their plastic utensils, get over yourself. You're probably the same person who eats at McDonald's where your burgers and fries are served in paper wrappers! Just sayin'....

Waffles Cafe promises you one thing: a cafe that serves waffles.  And it is quite the colorful cafe!  Bright yellow walls with white tables and chairs make for a cheery environment.  The menu is also made up of several chalkboards, with the whole menu handwritten in different colors!  It's a nice touch that makes me feel a little bit happier just walking into the place.  It also doesn't hurt that Jeff is always very hospitable and loves helping you decide on how to craft your perfect waffle.  If I'm up early in the morning and feeling like getting some good, quick breakfast, Waffles Cafe fulfills that feeling.  The one item that I've come to lean on is their Breakfast Special, which for under $6.00 gets you a plan waffle, eggs, bacon/sausage and unlimited coffee.  Yes, I've tried the waffle sandwiches, the waffle pizza's, the "dessert" waffles and all that, but I am perfectly fine with a plain waffle for breakfast.  The waffles are very good, and there is even a pumpkin batter option available.    The waffle sandwiches are exactly what they sound like; it's a sandwich that uses waffles instead of bread!  These tasty creations are waaay better than you would think, and the breakfast sandwich is deliciousness in a waffle (as opposed to on top off or beside).  Waffle pizzas are waffles with cheese and toppings on top.  Really, the waffles here are good enough where I don't mind replacing my bread or dough with them.  In addition to waffles they also serve boba drinks.  It's not the best I've had, but it'll do for when you have a craving for boba on this side of town.    Overall I've always been happy with the food and service, and will continue to come here.  Why the 4 stars?  If I'm looking to indulge...one waffle doesn't fill me up!  I've ordered a waffle sandwich and shared another waffle with a friend before and that was just right; add in a boba drink and you've crossed the $10 line, which is kinda pricey for breakfast.  (I did say that I was looking to indulge...)

Very friendly and quick service. Nothing fancy, you order at the counter then they bring to you on paper plates but quick and hot. We really enjoyed the waffles with fresh fruit and smoothies. Will be returning!

Great breakfast sandwich and delicious chicken and waffles. The homemade buffalo sauce is the bees knees. Kimberly is super friendly and knowledgeable of the food. All around great experience, will definitely be back to work my way through the menu

I tried this place for the first time days ago.  Im not a big waffle fan but this place won me over.  I had the chicken and waffle and a chocolate milk shake. I know what a funky combination.  All of it was sooo good. Chicken cooked perfectly and the waffle was great.  I look forward to going back to this place.  The price point is good for a small location..

Kim, the lady who assisted me was very nice and informative on menu selection.  It's posted by the register that they use the best ingredients so I was excited in tasting my waffle order.    To my disappointment, the waffles tasted terrible without whip cream and syrup.  The batter quality is substandard; thin, tasteless, cardboard-flavor.  I gave it another shot by dunking this waffle into my Starbucks coffee but it's unpalatable to me.  I shredded them into pieces and used it as bird food; They seemed to enjoy it!  What a waste of my $5.  Next time I'll invest this money into a breakfast buffet giving me assortment of waffles, pancakes and the likes.  So, so disappointed :(  I'm giving a one star for good customer service on Kim's part!

We went on a Saturday morning after a night of libations and we were in the mood for something to soak up some alcohol. I remembered reading Yelp reviews about this place and decided to check it out. I thought the concept of a breakfast sandwich or any sandwich at all on a waffle sounded pretty cool.   I guess I caught them on a bad day because I came away not impressed. They were understaffed but nevertheless, how long can it take to make a waffle? Well, on this day it took about an half hour to crank out one gentleman's order to dine in no less. Our order took about the same so we were plenty hungry by time we got home. Low and behold, we had to assemble our own sandwich! After reheating everything and then putting it together, it actually wasn't bad but way too much effort for the price. Most importantly though my kids didn't care for it at all. Sorry WaffleS.

It was ok, the waffle is pretty good but I got the egg thing they got with the special sauce and it was sweet I'm not a huge fan of sweet eggs. It's really light next time I'll just get the blueberry waffle

Waited over 1hr for food, with only a few customers in. Asked for coffee while I wait since I've waited over 45min n was charged for coffee to wait longer. Food wasn't great either for the that much of an wait Chef Romsey should have been back there!

This place was absolutely delicious!!! Their waffles were cooked perfectly and the prices were extremely reasonable. The employees were extremely friendly and accommodating. I would absolutely come here every time I'm in Vegas.
We ate here once. The food was okay, but nothing too exciting. There are much better places to get waffles around Vegas.

Super friendly with great prices and a good selection. If you are after waffles this is the place to check out. My kids were super excited to finally eat here. They split the Banana Split Waffle, and it was so big that they were barely able to finish it between the both of them.   I was excited to see that they also have boba teas and smoothies on their menu. That will be on my list to try on my next visit, along with a breakfast sandwich. My family doesn't go out for breakfast often, but I can see us returning here soon. This is the type of place that I could see us becoming regulars at. I love the hole in the wall family business vibe it has. You will never get that at any Denny's or IHOP in town and I am all for supporting the small business owner.

Not what I expected. Owner greeted us right away and explained the menu. I got a pumpkin waffle and bobby got a regular . I like places you sit and order at. We didn't realize it was counter service, but the service was great . Even though the pancakes were thin, they were airy. Mine did not have a lot of pumpkin taste. We wouldn't drive back up there, but if we were in the neighborhood we would eat there again
It's a smaller shop so there is a wait. I got the turkey club it was delicious! I found my new breakfast spot on this side of town.

The service was fast and the food was good. But when I ordered one of the women behind the counter argued with me about the menu. I kept saying ok to her over and over and she kept repeating that the menu item that read 'blazing chicken and waffle' was a sandwich. Ok, I still want that. And this went on for a few minutes and I finally just stopped talking. I still don't understand what the problem was. I just wanted to make sure they gave us the spicy chicken not plain. The drinks are what are going to get you here. Coffee is 1.79 and sodas are 2.29 and you get a 16.9 oz bottle and a cup of ice, no refills obviously. It's worth mentioning, there's something wrong with the ventilation system. After about 15 min everyone's eyes started watering and you could see the cloudiness towards the kitchen. They seem to be nice people and the food is reasonable priced, two adults and two kids (not ordering the kids menu) was $47 with the tip. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but I wouldn't argue if someone else wanted to come here.

Having passed by here often we finally decided to give it a try. We went in on a weekend very early morning. There weren't many people there at the time, but the crowd picked up after that. So the menu is much more extensive thanks I was expecting. We always go for classics when trying out a new place, so that what we ordered. The waffle was good, but not anything to really write home about. It too a while to come out and they wee served on disposable plates and plastic ware. Not a huge deal, but I guess I had higher expectations from a place called waffles cafe. So, not horrible, just not sure if ilk be running back for more anytime. If you've had and enjoy blueberry hill waffles you will more than likely be dissatisfied.  It's a cute place and they seem to have a nice following, so try it and see what you think. Maybe the waffle with lots of toppings are better.

Great food and great service! My son gets to eat an amazing waffle and I get something more healthy. No need for seasoning anything! Alex was so friendly and made our experience very enjoyable. We'll be regulars for sure!

pretty awesome relaxing and interesting little cafe, they let you make your own type of waffle, from protein, red velvet, fruity, or original. Best part are the potatoes! haha try it out! awesome place

Just didn't do it for me the customer service was good but food was so-so. The waffle was a little cold and they serve food on paper plates. It tasted like McDonald's waffles. It is plain and simple the food was not worth coming in for. If it had been served on fine china it still would have been cold and not very tasty. Just because the staff is nice that does not increase the quality of the dish. Better off going to IHOP. Damn I wish there was a Waffle House or roscoes chicken and waffles in north Las Vegas.

Jainie is such a friendly employee! Very nice. Even when there were no other customers, she kept busy by cleaning the tables and making sure nothing was on the floor. I love coming here. The environment is always cheerful and the food is awesome.

I like this place I would give it a 4.5 if you could. The good and waffles are good with a clean taste to the food. I think the lack of grease is what surprises people. For me and my family it provides a nice clean strawberry waffle or banana flax seed. We will definitely be going back from time to time.

Very reasonable prices and the food here is insanely good. I highly recommend the blazing chicken sandwich the sauce is very good. Also their flax seed waffles are delicious. I would definitely drive out of my way for this one.

Pretty nice place.  If you're looking for somewhere super fancy,  this isn't they place for you.  But if you want good food for a good price then this is the place for you.  The breakfast special was 6.99 and it includes a waffle,  eggs,  bacon or sausage,  and unlimited coffee.  It was pretty empty when we were there so it was nice and quiet.
The plus side is they have gluten free waffles! Down side is we paid $26 dollars for such small portions. This is restaurant prices... :(
I love the waffles and how you can put so many different types of to toppings. The service's is fast and very nice.

Decent food. Not a bad wait but its dirty literally every time I visit. All tables need to be cleaned and never get the attention. Chicken and waffles is ok, don't expect Roscoe's or southern quality. smoothies ok though

This place was really good I got the waffles with strawberry and whip cream, scrambled eggs, sausage and kiwi drink. Everything was so good no complaints. My husband got the waffles with chicken really good the strips were fresh and crispy taste really good. He got the strawberry lemonade drink bomb.com. Overall really great food service was really good going back.

The food : I tried the breakfast sandwich and was able to get all turkey based meats. Eggs, turkey , turkey sausage and cheese between a very fluffy waffle. It was a really good portion size and came with a side of potato chips. The sand which was great one of the better breakfast sandwiches I've had. I also had a side waffle with syrup. I have to say I love a fluffy waffle and this one really doesn't disappoint.  The service:  the service at this location was really good. Very friendly staff that's knowledgeable in case you need them to make you a recommendation. They got our food out quickly with out any issues.  I would definitely recommend waffles cafe for a quick breakfast that hits the spot.
Very good waffles but they don't use real plates or silverware and the walls are pretty dirty.
Food was decent.  Good place to get sit down and not feel rushed.  Would suggest getting more creative with waffles and make give it a twist.  But overall I would come back.

I loved the gluten free waffle! It is always a challenge to find gluten free pancakes and waffles and the other day I saw the sign that they had added GF waffles. I ordered it plain so I could taste the waffle on it's own, the texture and taste was wonderful.   I will definitely go back and try  the breakfast waffles and  other goodies they have. The inside is cheery and I wish I could remember the servers name, she is Korean, she was a delight and made my experience that much better. I also like that there are tables outside if you wish to eat al freco!

First time here. Food was good and service is okay. My husband got a Hawaiian pizza and breakfast sandwich; I got a regular waffle and fruit sandwich. I asked for no whipped cream but still got it on the sandwich when it was brought to me but it was easy to scrape off.  Not sure what the punch cards at the front are for since we weren't offered or given one. Maybe it's for the beverages.   I love my fruit sandwich and would be happy to come again.
This place was delicious and very well priced! They serve specialty breakfasts that you wouldn't think of, like a waffle breakfast sandwich! The staff was very attentive and friendly. Great place!

Food was good but service wasn't the best. We ordered our food and that came pretty quick. They forgot our drinks and my husband let the girl at the register know. She said they were behind and she will give us our drinks when she can. There were only 2 people sitting down, beside us. There were more people working in the back, and if you can't take care of your current customers, you shouldn't take in more customers.
Mm great waffles and choices. Had the breakfast one and bought a chicken sandwich for later. Great service and nice people

This was a great breakfast stop! A little out of the way of the Vegas congestion, but perfect stop on our way out of town. I had a waffle sandwich, consisting of a waffle folded in half, stuffed with fresh fruit and whipped cream. My husband had a peanut butter nutella waffle. Both were fabulous.
Great food, super nice staff and more than willing to explain the menu and process. Very clean and fast service!

I got a lot of hype about this place and it was good. It was not the best ever like a lot of people told me but, I will again for a second opinion. I had the Jimi's waffle and it was tasty. Kinda expensive and I hate paper plates and plastic untensils for things I have to cut.
First time here, their waffle is soooooooo good , very soft inside crispy outside yummy. I will come back

Cute place, orange walls, and slow jams in the background. What more can you ask for? As the name implies, it serves waffles in every way imaginable; waffle sandwiches, waffle pizzas, flaxseed waffles, you name it. What I love about this place is that you get to choose the type of waffle and toppings you would like. I've been here twice and my fave is the original waffle with strawberries, nutella, whipped cream, and powdered sugar. The flaxseed waffle is also good for all you healthy folks. They also have a breakfast special which is $5.49 for a waffle, bacon or sausage, eggs, and bottomless coffee. It's a great deal and the waffle is big. I did try the waffle sandwich which had ham, eggs, and bacon and some sort of sweet mystery sauce inside. To be honest, waffles taste good with about anything. The staff is very friendly and the place is small and intimate. So if you're craving waffles, keep this place in mind! P.S. Get a waffles stamp card

I guess I'm a fan again after a few positive again experiences. I also think now that they are doing combos, makes it for a fast, tasty and cheap meal option of a waffle breakfast, sandwich (with chips), waffle pizza,  etc. with a drink for under $7.   My favorite thing to get is breakfast waffle sandwiches (egg, cheese, ham, bacon) which makes for a good bit of savory and sweet. I pour some syrup in mine. The crinkle cut kettle chips are possibly homemade? These are plain, but good. They let me do ice tea as my beverage which is fresh brewed. They also added a water dispenser which is welcoming since I like to drink a lot while eating. My one negative thing is I liked their chicken sandwiches before, except now it seems they use ready made grilled strips. *womp, womp*   Still, I do like their fluffy style waffles here. It's different from what is usual, but it's a good kind of different. Definitely a plus I can come here in the afternoon and can order breakfast. I love not waking up early just to grab breakfast/brunch and deal with crowds on top of that.

I was really excited by the idea of this place. Sadly the food was just okay. It is just not worth the price to me. The waffle sandwiches are TINY.   I had a pumpkin waffle which was yummy but blow my mind in any way. I took it home to eat and it was already soggy and cold by the time I made it home a few miles away.   Sadly this place just wasn't as exciting as it could be.

Waffles, waffles, wafffffles!  Pretty much everything here has something to do with waffles.  Waffle sammiches,  desserty waffle sundaes, and waffle pizzas?!  You really have to appreciate the innovativeness of the owners of this place!  The waffles are really good.  It has a good crisp to the outside and its soft in the inside which is what a waffle should be!  The breakfast sandwich is awesome.  It's like all your favorite breakfast items in one bite!  Waffles, bacon, sausage (it came with ham, but I swapped it out for sausage), egg.  It comes with their special sauce, which you can opt to get it on the side.   I can't put my finger on what the sauce is, but I don't like it - its taste makes me feel weird.  I'd much rather drench the sandwich with syrup, but that's just me.  Also try the Yooni's special - it's pretty delicious.  It has your basic sundae toppings all over it.  Ice cream, strawberries, bananas, whip cream, chocolate sauce.  At $7+, I think it's a bit pricey.  I kept thinking to myself... I have a waffle maker, I can just make this at home!  Anyway, it was still delicious.    The place is small with can pose an issue for the busy weekend mornings.    The ambience is OK... I really like to orange walls and white furniture.  But I hate the fluorescent lighting in there and the floors look dingy.    That doesn't affect the quality of the food and service though.  Just sayin!     We will definitely be coming back here for their reasonably priced breakfast combo (5.49 for a regular waffle, eggs, coffee, and bacon or sausage).  Might even get one of the specialty waffles for a dessert after dinner one day (too much sugar for breakfast for me!).  Plus, its always good to support local business!

Visiting from Sacramento and we Yelped up this place for breakfast. In a word... outstanding. Best waffles we've ever eaten. The scrambled eggs were delicious. The bacon? LOOKED flat and unimpressive, but it, too, was delicious. Coffee came with our meals and was excellent. As we ate, the wall-mounted menu taunted me with a picture of a luscious-looking waffle pizza. Waffle pizza? Yup. Sounds strange, but looked mouth-watering. I hope to give it a try before we leave. If I do, I'll give you an update. The people were real sweeties, too.

I absolutely adore you, WaffleS Cafe! That's why we're MySpace friends!!!!!  My friend kept on raving about WaffleS Cafe since they opened, and she went  there at least THREE times a week in the early days. After having tried it, I totally understand now.   HAWAIIAN WAFFLE PIZZA: It's just a regular pizza--there's the tomato sauce, the cheese, and ham and pineapples....ON TOP OF A WAFFLE!!! served hot...absolutely delicious!  FRUIT SANDWICH (w/ nutella, strawberries, and whipped cream): Nutella? Strawberries? WC? What's not to like? Then, it's secured in a light, fluffy waffle... Wowowowowowowowow WOW

My cousin brought me here for the first time and I see why she is so devoted to this beautiful place. The people that work in there and run it to begin with are phenomenal!!! Add that on top of having a deliciously tasting assortment of waffles makes my taste buds and heart go crazy! I am a waffle fanatic by the way so a place like this is a slice of heaven.   I was very basic and ordered the classic breakfast (waffle, bacon/sausage, eggs). The waffle was good, don't get me wrong omg I've NEVER been served beautiful and hot eggs!!! I can't even keep my eggs that hot when I cook them myself... I'm hating lol. I also ordered a pineapple and peach smoothie (yasssss). I ordered a raspberry white chocolate waffle to go.   A thoughtful gesture, they waited on cooking my waffle order to go. It was brought out when it looked like we were getting ready to leave. Being the conversationalist that I am, we didn't leave right away which was totally fine. When we did decide to get up and leave, one of the employees says that she'll make me a fresh order. I'm like nooooo that's ok, this will be fine. She continued and then the guy explained how they wanted me to have a more fresh order. My heart filled with even more joy. That was going well above and beyond the expectations of customer service.  Granted I still had about two more stops before I got home, however these waffles were both perfectly fine despite my rough handling of my bags. This place will continue to receive my business and I hope wherever reads this will go and support this particular location of Waffles Cafe as well. There's more that I can add onto this review as of why I  it so much but I'm getting ready to dig into one of my waffles .

First time at this WaffleS. I usually drop into the one on Fort Apache and Trop but was meeting a friend for lunch. Ordered the usual: breakfast sandwich special with chips and a drink.  Breakfast sandwich is still amazing. I could eat that everyday. Still holding back on that 5th star due to the fact that they still don't have any other options except potato chips as a side. I want hash browns or tater tots or something!  Anyway, the moral of my story is that you should go here and eat a breakfast waffle sandwich. I haven't had anything else yet. The service at this location was friendly as well.

3rd trip here and I'm still loving it. Had the breakfast sandwich again and it was awesome. Waffles are perfect and the service is great. Wish I could bump this up to 5 stars but they really need more sides besides potato chips.

The waffles were cooked perfectly, the girl behind the counter came out and explained the menu very thorough. Fresh fruit bowl with turkey bacon accompanied my pumpkin waffle drizzled with pecan syrup. Good food overall at a decent price.

Nothing fancy. But delicious in every way.  I came here with an open mind, to see what all the hype was about. It was a Wednesday morning so no one was in there but me, and I had the coffee all to myself, woot woot! They even have my favorite creamers there, vanilla and hazlenut. YUUUUSSS!  Price range is neat, $6 for a big ass waffle, eggs and bacon. The waffle was amazing in my book, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Eggs. They were eggs. Bacon kinda looked dry and stale to me, which disappointed me at first, but I guess it had a jerky texture to it, so in the end it wasn't that bad at all.  I like how everything is served on disposable utensils. From the paper plates to the plastic forks. I'm an odd germy-phobe, so to not have to worry about whether the dishes were washed properly definitely lifted my spirits.  I saw they had some sort of waffle pizza on the menu, which I really want to come back a try.

I was excited to try a new place for brunch because usually I have sunday brunches at home.  My fiance and I were greeted by Jeff, who is very friendly and helpful. He noticed it was our first time there and helped us choose our meals.  I ordered the breakfast sandwich and Chris ordered the breakfast special.  The menu is pretty easy to understand and there are pictures on the wall to help you as well.  The waffles were sooo good. I'm usually not a waffle person, but these ones were just right: buttery, a lil sweet, soft. I LOVE the breakfast sandwich, my bacon was just the right crispiness and cooked to my liking.  Chris enjoyed his meal and he snuck a couple bites of my sandwich.  The cafe was clean, the staff was fryiendly and best of all the food is good! Can't wait to try a dessert waffle, waffle pizza or the other waffle sandwiches!
This place is AMAZING!! Great service, very friendly staff and knows what's good here .. plus they are very eco friendly big plus for me
My BLT was great. I ordered chicken and waffle for my son but I ended up moving in on that as well. #SorryNotSorry

I would go back for the waffle sandwich and for the guy that took our order, but both orders of our regular waffles were hard, dry, and cold. Some of the side options, like sausage, are a little overpriced for the amount of food that you get.
Service was good but the waffles were not good at all. No flavor whatsoever. Id say good prices had I been excited about my food. Overall, mediocre at best

For the 3 years that I've lived and worked in this area - I finally decided to come here for my birthday breakfast. I have no idea why I haven't come here before. I remember someone telling me that it was "ok" and it's "just waffles".   No sir, this is not just waffles. These are delightful, crispy, amazing waffles. I love them so much, so so so much.   I got the organic waffle with - Strawberries Peanut Butter Chocolate Chips Bananas Almonds   - I used the sugar free syrup, and to my surprise, it was amazing. They do have real maple syrup if you're looking for a sugar high.   I really could not get over how good these were. Probably because I'm on pretty strict clean diet and I don't have too many amazing cheat meals like this. But good god...It was worth it.   The service was awesome - the only thing is they forgot my kiwi's...but I don't even care. I really don't.   If you drive by this place and you're wondering if you should try it out, yes. You should. Especially if you're a waffle lover, like myself.

I was very unimpressed with the waffles. They were very thin and airy almost like a wafer. No substance taste or texture. Thank God for the strawberries or we would have been starving,  Eggo waffles are better

Waffles were pretty darn amazing!  They have unique flavors like pumpkin and red velvet.  The woman behind the counter had amazing customer service! Smiling and enthusiastic.  It was my first time there and she explained how the menu worked.  Considering they have so many options, it loved her explanation of the waffles and what types of combos you can get.  Pumpkin waffle with nutella, coconut and bananas were amazing.  Oreo milkshake could have had a little more oreo in it.  Overall, one waffle with toppings was extremely filling!  A little steep on the prices....but good breakfast!

Waffle Cafe is one of those little restaurants in a small plaza that people overlook.  If you see it, I recommend you give it a try. The sandwiches here are really good because they add that special sauce (secret recipe) to every sandwich they make that gives it a sweet flavor to it. I like the chicken sandwich but you can't go wrong with any of them. You can even have them replace the regular waffle with chocolate waffles if you want your food to be sweeter.  The smoothies here are ok. The coconut is my favorite and this is the first place I've ever tried a coconut smoothie so I can't really say if other places are better. They also have several desserts to choose from as well, all placed on top of their waffles.  Everything here is basically substituted with a waffle (pizza. sandwich, etc). Only if they would add fried chicken to the menu, this place would be the ultimate sh*t, the lil' Roscoes Chicken & Waffles of Vegas!

Waffles waffles waffles this place is amazing if you are a waffle lover. They have every type of waffle and topping you can think of. You can create your own or try one of their favorites. I had the chicken and waffles that was fantastic. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. A must stop if your are in the area. Waffles!!

The family who run the cafe are really friendly and the waffles are light and crispy so I don't feel like dying after the meal! It's relatively close to red rocks national park, so i ended up getting breakfast here almost every morning.

I went here afte checking the reviews and it was close. This place is ok I usually give spots another chance so I will update soon but for now I really wasnt amazed. I had a waffle breakfast sandwich and it tasted like something i couldve made at home.

Update!  Seems like they listened to some of our complaints, and finally added some background music!  It is very subtle, but really makes the environment more welcoming.  Service was friendly as always, and the place is clean!  The reason why it got the review bump.....the breakfast sandwich!  It came with eggs, bacon and etc inside a waffle sandwich!  The portion was good for the price ($5.99), and the taste was very good.  As you know already from reading the other reviews, the waffles here are great, so it works together perfectly and is nice and clean on the hands.  Check out the pic :  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/waffles-cafe-las-vegas-2?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#-N2RRW15OVLymuWeMRpgug  Also, because it is a sandwich, I couldn't complain about the paper plates or plastic silverware lol.  I think I will order their sandwiches from now on!  Give it a try :)

Ok, this review is for the Korean BBQ Waffle and the differences I saw between this location and their Durango location.  Korean BBQ Waffle ($8.95): Top Sirloin Beef marinated in Korean seasonings. This is essentially a Bulgogi Waffle, but the meat was too thick, tough, and not full of flavor. Also, the waffle is not as "done" as the other location, and it isn't the reason WHY I go to the other location....the amazing waffles!  Would not recommend at all.   I tried the Large Peach Smoothie with Boba ($5.29). This is pretty good.  I like their boba here.  Comparing my favorite item here, Jeff's Favorite / Sweet P ($6.95): Pumpkin Waffle, Apple Pie Filling, Vanilla Ice Cream, Caramel and Cinnamon.  Aliante : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/waffles-cafe-north-las-vegas?select=S47ZPr_kqGeOL9v0mmd5Ng#S47ZPr_kqGeOL9v0mmd5Ng  Durango : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/waffles-cafe-las-vegas-2?select=4Zl25rlUpeDbRVRMXRBESA#7QFOLG_0Py-Lv4mCMbmwLg  I'll let you decide who makes it better!  More pics :
Wonderful food!  If your near North Las Vegas you need to stop here!  Highly recommended to all!
Amazing service, great food at good prices, and many healthy options! It is nice to fontina breakfast place that has gluten free options!

If you like waffles, then this place might worth the drive for you if your either here for the weekend in Vegas or just happen to live in the area.   Yoonies favorite is probably the most colorful and best looking waffle. Look at the picture for yourself. It will put anyone with a sweet tooth into submission.   I was lucky and fat enough to try 4 different waffles here.   1. The Ham and Bacon Waffle Sandwich.  2. The Yoonies Favorite.  3. Jeffs Favorite 4. The one with bananas, caramel, and white chocolate. lol.   All of them were delicious. It takes quite a while for them to make it because obviously they spend time on the presentation.   The Ham and Bacon Waffle Sandwich was good but different. The special sauce made the gf want to vomit. I thought it was tasty.   Yoonies favorite was delicious w/ the whipped cream, loved the ice cream of course, but I wish the chocolate was replaced with caramel instead.   Jeffs favorite came with cinnamon apples, caramel, whipped cream and ice cream. Pretty good but not a fan of cinnamon apples.   The one with bananas, caramel, and white chocolate was by far the best in my book. Kept simple, but tasted so good.   No need to  worry on a limited selection since you can go ahead and create your very own waffle. Watch what you mix here though, some things just dont go well together.   Glad I tried it at least once. Now I know what Waffles Cafe is all about.

When it comes to breakfast places around the valley, the hype is hit or miss. For WaffleS Cafe, definitely a miss. Ever since we purchased the Groupon, my brother and I have been pushing back coming here for weeks now. Before I left for Seattle, I was resolute about coming here, yet I'm not impressed with our visit.  I ordered the Alexa's: strawberry waffle topped with both fresh strawberries and strawberry ice cream with whipped cream and chocolate syrup. For the drink, a milk tea always wins. My brother ordered the Yooni's: bananas, strawberries, whipped cream, and chocolate syrup atop an organic flax waffle (subbed for the original for a dollar more). Sticking to his blatant love for all things Asian, he ordered the Taro tea. The wait seemed a bit much, with not much attention paid towards us in the meantime.   After devouring our plates, we agreed: we loved parts of both, but not the entire thing. My waffle was absolutely delicious: subtly sweet with enough strawberry flavor. The fruit was clearly fresh, but the overall flavor combination wasn't enough to tempt me for a second visit. However, my milk tea was sweet enough to cause a cavity upon first sip. The boba was perfect: chewy and addictive.   What left a worse taste in my mouth was the service. The owner was cordial enough towards the two of us, but seemed extraordinarily accommodating towards every customer thereafter. I would come back only to try the savory sandwiches or even the waffle pizzas, but as for the hype, I just don't see it.

Customer service was great, and the place was nice inside, and great prices but I just didn't like the food.   My fiance got a Waffle pizza and I got an Original with raspberries. I added some eggs and bacon along with it.  I tasted some of my fiance's pizza and you could taste the frozen veggies.. Not for us.

My boyfriend and I would normally eat at Denny's on Tropicana and Fort Apache for breakfast as a treat.  But, their price doesn't match their quality of food.  We tend to feel robbed after dining in.  For a while when going to Walmart or Burger King in this area, I would always wonder about Waffles Cafe.  Last week, while unpacking to settle in our new our apartment I had decided to get us some breakfast from this little dive breakfast joint.  I ordered two Breakfast Specials which included:  Waffles with banana, whip cream, powdered sugar sprinkled on top, and maple syrup on the side; Scrambled eggs, bacon, and added sausage for an additional $1.  With this, I got a free coffee.  To substitute it with orange juice, it's another $1.  All in all, I spent about $18 plus tip.  This is a good price compared to spending around $35 at Denny's.  When I got home, my boyfriend was pleasantly surprised after he opened his container of food.  His waffles had strawberries sprinkled with powdered sugar and maple syrup on the side.  When he started eating the sausage, eggs, and bacon, the look on his face was priceless.  I agreed with his look as I was biting in to my food.  Everything tasted perfect.  Normally, the sausage is something that is just blah.  This sausage actually had meat.  It wasn't the dinky little kind that Denny's serves.  The bacon was crispy and crunchy, not too oily just how bacon should be made.  The waffles that came with the meal topped it off nicely.   As I was spreading the butter on my waffles, my boyfriend made a comment on how great everything was.  After I let the maple syrup drop all over the waffles, I dove right in.  I couldn't believe how much I loved it.  The taste is comparable to getting a new bra in Victoria Secret - EXCITING, NEW, AND UNFORGETTABLE.  I've never really eaten waffles as much as I would pancakes.  After this experience, I've been converted.  I would definitely take their waffles over any pancakes any day.  We'll be here more often for breakfast.  Mmm-mmm-mmmmmmm.

This place is Waffle euphoria from traditional to contemporary. I ordered the blazing chicken and waffle sandwich. It was so good I ordered one to go. I wish they had it in NY. The staff was friendly and very helpful. She gave an overview of the entire menu highlighting the more popular items including her favorites.

Love the chicken and waffles and homemade grits.  Can't get enough.  My wife and I come in every weekend.  The owner, Kim, is very friendly and attentive. Great service and great food. Can wait to be back!

We have only been here once, but we can't wait to take he whole family back and try many other items on their menu.   I'm not sure if this was first a food truck, but it gives me that impression. The menu is a big plastic banner sign and they serve everything on paper plates. (Save money on dishwashers, I guess!)   The staff that helped us was very kind and helpful. Everything that we saw on other people's plates looked amazing.   We both got a breakfast sandwich. Yum! I couldn't finish it, but enjoyed the half that I ate.
The service is over the top excellent. The food was good enough to warrant a 5 star review coupled with excellent service. I would recommend this location!
After reading the reviews... I am glad they were CLOSED when we went there today. Signs in the windows say that they are closed with no expected opening date

The name does not lie as pretty much the only food item on the menu is waffleS. Waffle pizzas, waffle sandwiches (breakfast and lunch varieties), waffle sundaes and waffle waffles. There are different waffle flavors, including pumpkin and chocolate, and then there are the toppings which include cherry pie filling, nuts, peanut butter, and ice cream to name just a few of the sweeter options. They also have boba teas and smoothies.   I was a bit bummed that they did not offer soysage because that prevents the vegetarians among us from taking advantage of the breakfast special: waffle, eggs, bacon or sausage, and coffee for $5.49. The vibe is so youthful and forward that I assumed they just must have some alternative meat options, but alas, I was wrong.   The space is definitely cute with orange walls and mod, white plastic furniture. It is small, only about 10 tables, and it is counter service. Because it is so small, I would not bring a brood of children here, as it can get crazy quickly in such a compact area. I was surprised, as I had imagined a bigger more restauranty place, but I was not disappointed with the atmosphere. The servers were all cheerful and patient with us newcomers who must have stared at the wall for 5-minutes trying to grasp all of the possible combinations and debating what we wanted: "You really think that cherry pie filling and ice cream is too much sugar for breakfast?"  Ultimately, we went pretty simple with plain waffles and a side of peanut butter. (I am one of those who puts peanut butter on every griddle breakfast item.) The waffles were tasty, crispy and featured nice, deep griddle holes (crucial for quality waffles). At $7 for two waffles it might be a little pricey, especially when you can catch the breakfast buffet at lots of places for around that, but I am still giving WaffleS 4-stars. It might be a very objective 3-star culinary experience, but I am giving it a bonus star for being so devoted to waffles. In my little world, devotion is worth one bonus star.

Out with my kids and decided to get some late breakfast this morning. I've seen Waffles Cafe before and been curious about the food/concept. Our experience was pretty mixed. Cons: menu is confusing and "building your own combo" takes a hot minute to figure out. Are we in a Boba place or a milkshake place or a Waffle place? Are we better at breakfast or lunch? Slightly confusing.  Bathroom is dingy, maybe just unkept?, and waffle wasn't hot when served (butter-didn't-melt unhot). Brand feels a little confused somewhere between fast food and mom and pop diner. Fancy waffle around $7-$9 (for just the waffle). Syrup was thin and sweet, not very maple-y, as I had hoped for a waffle place. If you just order a simple waffle with syrup, I think you'd be disappointed. Pros: fruit bowl came with fresh mangos, pineapples and blueberries (amazing fruit bowl). Sandwiches and kids meal come with side/drink. "Coffee bar" and hot sauce bar had nice assortment. Most enjoyable was A.J. She greeted us, took our order and was incredibly friendly and informative. She saved our experience, which dependent on the food/cost, wasn't overly impressive.  We ordered mostly breakfast items and if we were to return might try the lunch/brunch items. I have a feeling those might be stronger than the breakfast items we ordered.
Always fresh delicious and healthy waffles as well as a full assortment for breakfast and lunch. A must for locals!

This place is the BEES KNEES! We ordered the breakfast sandwich and a regular waffle with strawberries and apple pie filling. Who would have thought apple pie filling on a waffle would be THAT delicious! Deff going to be a returning customer!

#86 After an eventful, exciting, and tiring experience at TAO the night before, we decided we wanted something delicious, hearty, and healthy for brunch. We looked up waffle places in the area and came across WaffleS Cafe. It was going to be a bit of a drive out (we were staying at the Stratosphere), but we figured it was worth it based on the reviews online. When we got there, we were a bit underwhelmed since it seemed like we'd just driven back into suburbia, with WaffleS Cafe situated in your typical suburban shopping center.   However, walking in, we were pleased. =) The place was cute, with plenty of pink to go around. The interior decor could have and should be ramped up, but who's to complain, really. We ordered one order of the Tuna Sandwich waffle and another Original one where we added sweet toppings. The prices weren't terrible (and, really, something that I miss being in Philly) and the quality was great. The carbs were exactly what we needed to cure the hangovers and it was nice to see families coming and going.   Not sure if I'd ever be able to make it back here, save for those few and far between trips to Vegas, but I'm giving this place a thumbs' up!

Word is they shop for fresh ingredients locally three times a week to hand make quality waffles daily.    It sure tasted like it!    I had the pumpkin waffle with Nutella topping.  Light crunch on the outside and fluffy inside.  I also enjoyed the original waffle with whipped cream, powdered sugar, and topped with caramel sauce.   My waffle was part of a breakfast special which came with eggs, bacon, and unlimited coffee....Perfect way to start the day!    It felt a little stuffy in this small cafe, but I got used to it.  Staff was very polite and helpful, especially with the free wi-fi.   I've got my eye on the waffle sandwiches or the waffle pizza for my next visit.

After a long morning of fasting, having blood drawn, and sitting at the DMV, my husband and I were STARVING on Thursday morning, and decided to look up someplace nearby for breakfast.    Pulling up my trusty Yelp app, I located Waffles Cafe, and we decided to check it out.   Upon entering, we were greeted warmly by Kim, who I found out a little later is the owner.  She asked if we'd been in before, and after finding out that we hadn't, let us know that if we had questions about the menu, to just ask, and she's more than happy to help.    The menu is big, but not too overwhelming.  I had a hard time picking because everything looked wonderful.   We decided on:  Chicken and waffles for my fella, and the "create your own" waffle combo for me.   I've seen a couple reviews knocking the place because they use paper plates and plastic utensils, but it didn't bother me at all.  At least the plates/cups are biodegradable.    The thing is, this isn't a fancy restaurant or a chain like Ihop or Denny's.  Its super cute, super clean (like...she wipes down the hot sauce bottles after they've been used), and cozy.  I'm not so pretentious to be bothered by eating off paper plates.    I also ordered a taro boba drink, which was heavenly.  Boba was the perfect consistency.    When the food arrived, everything was HOT.  Like...I burned my mouth on the grits, hot.    Fella's chicken and waffles were good.  We're 99% sure that the chicken is breaded in house and not store bought.  They were tasty.  Not greasy at ALL, which thrilled me.   The chicken came with this sauce...we think its a honey mustard type base with hot sauce, and it is DELICIOUS.  I'd eat this all day long.  Fella's waffle was really good too.    I opted for the "create your own" waffle combo.  This is exciting, because there are at least 5 or 6 different waffle bases for you to choose from: Original, Gluten free, Red Velvet, Chia Seed, Flax seed...SO many to choose from!   For Thursday's visit, I chose the original batter, with pecans.  (there were LOTS of other toppings, but I was in the mood for simple)  The combo comes with 2 sides and a drink.  I chose bacon, grits, and did my boba slushie, with an upgrade charge.    So the waffle itself comes with powdered sugar and whipped cream.  We had regular syrup too.  The waffle was really good.  Crunchy on the outside, moist on the inside...perfect.    The grits were burn your mouth hot, but delicious.  Best grits I've had in ages, truth be told.  Throw in a little butter (which it came with on the side)...mmmm.  I was in heaven.  The bacon was cooked well.  I wish there was more than 2 pieces to a side, but I think that's pretty standard for "sides" of bacon at other places too.  Who doesn't want more bacon all the time anyway?    We were checked on a couple of times, but not too many.  Service really was top notch.    I definitely plan to return, there are lots of items on the menu that I want to try out!!

I was in Summerlin running errands (a rare occurance for me!) and logged onto mobile yelp to find a restaurant. Waffles popped up and I'm so glad it did!   First off, it's family owned and the people working there are all very sweet and caring. It was dinner time, but that didn't stop us from wanting waffles- why can't waffles be a dinner food too? We tried the waffle hawaiian pizza, the breakfast sandwich, and a waffle with chocolate chips, caramel and whipped cream. The pizza was so cute and creative. They bake it in the oven so the cheese gets nice and melty. I really loved it. Fiance seemed to love his sandwich and the dessert waffle was awesome.   I liked that they had some flavored batters (pumpkin, chocolate, flax-soy). However, I wish they could put some toppings IN the batter. Like say bacon in the batter or chocolate chips in the batter, etc. I think that would greatly improve things!  Prices were relatively reasonable for what it is! I wish it wasn't so freaking far away - I never go to Summerlin.
Definitely creative use of waffles. I wasn't overly impressed with my meal but others with me were. Worth a try but not my thing!
Seriously I  just had the simple breakfast special with a waffle, 2 eggs, and turkey sausage.... BOMB. And the cashier was kind as well!

Went this morning for first time even though it is not that far from my house (maybe 10 or so mins). I thought the set up and the food were great. The menu was on the wall, then ordered at the counter, got my self serve coffee, and the food was brought out like 5 mins later. For 6.50 tax included, I got the breakfast special-a waffle, 2 strips of crispy bacon, 2 eggs and coffee. The bacon and eggs were gravy, the star was the waffle-more crispy with the inside softness more so towards the middle/center of the waffle. Everything tasted fresh and not processed. The waffle was so good that I ordered a second. I left an hour later relaxed, full and completely satisfied.  I was a bit weary to eat off paper plates and plastic utensils (as I had read this in other reviews and as a rule do not like to) but, the experience was so good that it didn't bother me at all, almost didn't notice it.

I remember when Waffles Cafe was located in a shopping area by Tropicana and Fort Apache. A couple years passed and it had moved to this location on N Durango. I was surprised that it had moved from a busy, high traffic neighborhood to a random quiet plaza in the north west. It was always busy in the old location and the food never disappointed.   Since they've moved, I've only gone to this location 2 times. While the food is still great, it feels so depressing inside knowing how quiet and dead it is in this location. They really need to move back to the SW side of town.

This place was super close to our friends house. Even if I stayed on the strip, I would make the trip out. It's a nice clean place. I'm not to sure if it's family owned or not. My boyfriend ordered the breakfast sand which. I was rather hungry so I got the strawberry&banana waffle sand which plus a breakfast special. Yes! I ate it all! Service was fast. The staff was super nice! Food came out pretty fast. Oh! And they have boba tea! Waffles were a good size and fluffy with the right about of crisp to them. And they have a bathroom on site, in case you wanna get "lost"  So overall. Everything was great!

I tried was bored with the usual breakfast places and searched on Yelp for a highly rated place, it was right across the street from me!  When I walked in I wasnt sure how the process worked b/c everyone working there was busy making batter..  I soon found out that you order like a fast food joint and sit down, then they bring the food out to you.    I just asked them what the most popular was, the recommended the breakfast sandwich, and i can see why.  I was unusual to have a breakfast sandwich with waffles as the bread, but it was awesome.  Only problem was the side.. plain potato chips, weird..  I could have ate two of them b/c i as pretty hungry.    I am going to frequent based on price!  Open from 0600-5pm
Yum would definitely go here again! I had the waffle chicken sandwich with the special buffalo sauce. So good!

Ehh... It was ok. More like a waffle shop than a cafe. Waffles were ok. They go crazy with waffles, similar to all the fillings you'd find in crepes - fruits, meats, pizza stuffing, etc... Only bad thin is it's located at the end of Vegas, kinda far, not worth the long trip (or gas)! Found hair in our eggs, although the guy was very nice and made new eggs, still a bit gross. Maybe they should wear hair nets. Likely won't eat there again, but the service was decent.

Items Selected: Banana Split - Chocolate Waffle with Banana, Ice Cream, Chocolate Sauce, Almond, Sprinkles, Whipped Cream ($8.19) The Sweet P - Pumpkin Waffle, Apple Pie Filling, Vanilla Ice Cream, Caramel, Cinnamon ($7.95)  Located in Centennial and another long-term member of my breakfast 'to-do' list it was finally on Saturday Morning after a stop at the new Al's Donuts and Café Burger that I decided to stop by Waffles Café and although a suspicious server inquiring as to why I was taking pictures of the wall-mounted menu was a touch off-putting the food itself proved well worth the trip.  Every bit a 'locals only' sort of spot, hidden in a small strip-mall on the East side of North Durango, it was just after 7:30am that I entered the brightly lit space and finding myself to be the restaurant's only patron until a family of four arrived at eight o'clock both order and service were expedited, the mother and sons team chatting amongst themselves in the kitchen while I watched Obama address the Iraq situation via wall-mounted LCD in back.
