Obviously content in sticking to the waffle-centric theme with a menu entailing options either sandwiched or standard it was only after substantial debate that I eventually settled on two of the items listed under "Specials" and declining further customization beyond making my Banana Split base chocolate I'm happy to say both piping hot options proved divine, the mountainous split's base harkening the flavor of hot cocoa beneath ripe bananas while the Sweet P's supple crumb was soaked through with cinnamon spiced apples and a liberal ladle of caramel for a decidedly sweet experience just barely reined in by the slowly melting ice cream.

Ah waffles, they are for people who has texture problems. Like people who can't eat pancake because it tastes like a gop of syrup or basically a sugary sponge. Well, fear no more! You can have nice crispy edges from the Waffle Cafe.   This place is homey. I mean, really homey. By that I mean you get regular Ruffles chips with your order. You get something like a George Foreman grilled chicken breast if you want the chicken with your waffles, which is what I had. So pretty much, its everything you can make at home. But if you don't want the mess and want something quick and really simple, come here. The people are nice, they serve boba, which is a plus but I haven't tried. Maybe next time.

A great lil joint. Awesome people always smiling and making sure they get ur meal/drink just perfect. I went in there to order something but they had never made it the way I tried it years back in a diff state but that didn't stop them, they wanted to create it for me and they did. Great service
Best waffles ever! Light, crispy & yummy. This is a "no frills" Mom & Pop place. Great staff. Suggest the breakfast special. My boyfriend have been back to this place several times.
Second time here. Had the turkey club sandwich. I love how waffles are used in place of bread!!! Friendly staff. Very inexpensive

After a good nite sleep Ben rushed us to WaffleS. which was quite a journey considering its not down the strip and its actually in the normal part of LasVegas  we pulled into a fairly empty plaza and went into the small but cute WaffleS.  you head up to the counter and you order one of the prefixed waffles or you create your own from the extra friendly waiter/cook/owner? they also have waffle sandwiches and meals where it comes with a side of bacon/sausage & eggs  my waffle was supposed to consist of a coffee waffle, caramel, white chocolate & bananas.. & hannah's waffle was a plain waffle with marshmellows, nutella, peanut butter, whip cream and some other craazy mess.  however!!! our waffles mustve got switched up cuz i got plain and she got coffee =( which totally sucks for hannah because she hates coffee and it was actually NOT good.(stick with plain) poor girl.  everyone loved their order...hello its like everything u want for breakfast that your mama wont let u have! waffle with chocolate caramel syrup with more sugary toppings with a scoop of icecream who wouldnt love it?   again its by preference (since ben LOVED it )but the sauce in the ham & bacon waffle sandwich did NOT work for me. at all. literally made me gag. its like a slightly sweet thick olive oil-ish concoction ; makes my mouth water (in the bad way) just thinking about it!
great little breakfast spot! food is very good. prices are more reasonable. staff is friendly. I had the waffle sandwich. nothing fancy wich is great. just a good place for good food.

It was just okay. I came here with a few friends and was kind of underwhelmed.  I ordered the chicken and waffle and the chicken was obviously a frozen chicken was the premade chicken you would buy in the frozen aisle of the grocery store. it was tasteless. probably won't be back.

I'd pick waffles over pancakes any day (although I frequent a pancake establishment only because it's close to my office).  Waffles cafe has smoothies, boba tea, hot tea, waffle sandwich, waffle pizza and the good ol' waffles.  They have specials:  Breakfast for $5.99: waffle + egg+ bacon OR sausage + unlimited coffee OR add $1 for other drinks.  Lunch for $6.49: waffle sandwich + chips + soda OR waffle pizza + soda  The Sweet P for $6.95: pumpkin waffle with apple pie filling + vanilla ice cream + caramel + cinnamon  Short Cake Split for $7.45: original waffle + strawberry + banana + vanilla ice cream + chocolate sauce  Banana Split for $6.69: banana + ice cream + chocolate sauce + almond + sprinkles + whipped cream  You can also create your own waffle from $3.95-8.95 (choose from original, oat, flax, chocolate, pumpkin) and add toppings from 75 cents-$1 (walnut, pecan, strawberry, sprinkles, peanut butter, Nutella, chocolate chips, marshmallows, Reese's chips, chocolate sauce, M&M's, caramel sauce, coconut, banana, kiwi, mango, peach, blueberry, raspberry, apple pie filling, cherry pie filling) or maybe get a side of bacon, sausage, egg or wheat toast for $1.50.  I built my own waffle. I had the original with Nutella + strawberries + mangoes. They added powdered sugar and whipped cream on top.  Since I already have Nutella, I didn't put any syrup on my waffle.  The syrups they have include maple, sugar, boysenberry, etc.  Food is served on a paper plate and they'll give you a plastic fork and knife. The downside to that is it's not too appealing but I guess the good thing about that is if you want to take your food to-go, you can just put foil on top and voila!
Skip.  Friendly service and free Wi-Fi but the food was nothing special. The kiddos didn't like the waffles (what kid doesn't like waffles???) Go to Baby Stacks instead.

The people were great. The food was good  Actually more filling then I thought. Small place so be willing to take to go. The kid portions were big enough for two kids or one adult. Love a family business.
Nice little mom and pop type place with excellent chicken and waffles and even better customer service.
I love this place. The chicken tenders and waffle were great. The potato scramble was also good. Will def be going back

First time at Waffles Cafe, we've heard great things and we love breakfast. First impressions, clean restaurant albeit empty! Friendly staff at the counter. We had the littles with us so we ordered a double order of the original waffles with whipped cream and strawberries, a chocolate chip waffle, and a ham and bacon waffle sandwich. It's a seat yourself joint, so we picked a table and grabbed some booster seats. Hubby grabbed his coffee at the self serve coffee bar and I grabbed my water. About 10 minutes after placing our order we got our food. They forgot our Littles chocolate milk and it took a second to get them. The food was hot the waffles crisp and fluffy on the inside. But it wasn't mind blowing. They forgot no tomatoes on the sandwich and it was just very underwhelming for the price. I think this place is best for dessert waffles.

Loved this place! Great food. Great Service. Even better prices.   At breakfast, I have a hard time deciding between a sweet or savory meal. French Toast or Hashbrowns? Waffles or Bacon & Eggs? Well, at Waffles I ordered the Breakfast Sandwich which satisfied both of my desires. Bacon & Eggs sandwiched between a Waffle with a sweet sauce to tie it all together.  It was DELICIOUS! I was completely satisfied when finished - probably because I got the best of both worlds!

I got pumpkin waffle with turkey sausage and eggs, it was pretty good. I really liked the fluffy waffles with blueberries. The waffles are warm and berries were fresh. Definitely will be coming back for waffles. Also, very friendly and accommodating staff.

Whenever I get a hankering for breakfast food, do I go to Denny's or Ihop?  Nay, nay, I head on over to the Waffles Cafe.  The owners are super cool, the food is awesome, and they play great music.  If it's not too busy, sometimes one of the servers busts out his guitar!  Recommendations:  1) Breakfast waffle sandwich- ham, scrambled eggs, bacon, cheese and the house sauce all nestled in one delicious, homemade waffle.  It comes with chips as well!  2) Breakfast special- if you are in the mood for a more traditional breakfast, you can pretty much get everything separated.  Two eggs however you like them, bacon or sausage, and a drink.  3) Create your own- your choice of plain, chocolate or pumpkin waffle then whatever toppings you want!  Chocolate waffle with strawberries and bananas is quite good.  4) Miscellaneous- they have regular turkey or ham waffle sandwiches and waffle pizza for the more adventurous!

Waffles Cafe has been on my to go to list for so long. It took a Groupon sale to finally get me over to the shop. At first I was expecting a sit down spot, but it turns out to be concession style. This is good because it keeps the cost down.  The Groupon was good for two specialty waffles and two drinks. My sister had ordered a milk tea boba and the Alexa's; a strawberry waffle, fresh strawberries, strawberry ice cream, whipped cream, and chocolate syrup. I got the taro boba and the Yooni's; subbed the original waffle for an organic flax waffle for a dollar, fresh bananas, strawberries, vanilla ice cream, chocolate syrup, and whipped cream. I found that I liked components of both the waffles, but not the whole. The waffles are amazing. They are just the way I like them, a little dense and cake like. The flavor is superb, but I could not tell if I really got the flax waffle or not. If it was then they use flax meal. The fruit were firm and not slimy. If I got it without the chocolate syrup and whipped cream, I would have been happier. I had the same issue with their boba. I loved the tapioca balls, but the drinks were too sweet.   WaffleS Cafe's strong points are their reasonable prices and the build your own options. The eight different waffles and large array of toppings are only limited by the customer.

Went here for the first time today. Really cool place!! VERY clean and comfortable! Kim was GREAT very helpful and friendly!! I had the spicy chicken and waffle sandwich with waffle fries. I have to say, those were the absolute best waffle fries I have ever had! They were cooked perfectly!! The sandwich was amazing! The sauce that they put on it should be bottled and sold in stores!!! And its homemade!! The best part was the prices!! Everything was between $5-$8!!!! More than affordable for great quality and perfect portions!! I will definitely be back, and take my whole family next time!! GREAT place!!!!

The service was friendly, the restaurant was clean and bright and the menu offered so many different options of waffles!  I love waffles.  I live in LA and there are no "build your own" waffle shops.  This place offered different types of waffle batter, fruit toppings (strawberries, bananas, blueberries, etc.), candy toppings (M&M's, chocolate chips, etc.) and lots of other yummy indulgences (Peanut butter, nutella, chocolate sauce, apple pie filling, etc.).  I had a Banana, peanut butter and chocolate chip waffle and it was delicious!  My friend ordered a strawberry and M&M waffle It comes with whipped cream and syrup and is cooked fresh to your order.  They have a few specials like Waffles with eggs and bacon or sausage, a waffle pizza and waffle sandwich.  I highly recommend this waffle shop!  The ingredients are fresh, you are limited only by your imagination and the end result is delicious!  Plus you can't beat the price: $3.75 for a plain waffle and each topping is only $.50!  What a steal!  I wish I lived in Vegas, because I'd eat here every day!

This place never ceases to amaze!  It has been 2 1/2 months since I was last here and Jeff remembered me.  That's great service.  Oh and the food is wonderful too.  Definitely worth the drive away from the overpriced strip.
This was a superb waffle café, I love the experience the servers were polite and very understanding, they got the order wrong and waive the fee for it

Waffles cafe is a no frills breakfast cafe with perfectly prepared waffles and other breakfast items. It seems like a family run business, the staff is always friendly. I've had the waffle breakfast sandwich and I've had the waffles with eggs and bacon. My daughter loves the pizza waffle. The waffle itself is crunchy in initial texture yielding to the soft and sweet breading inside. It's not fancy or expensive and I've never had a bad experience earing here.   If you don't want to wait an hour to eat at babystacks just drive down the street and this place won't disappoint.

This place is very tasty- so many options you will change your mind every time you think you made a decision.  I built my own meal - got the Red Velvet waffle - tasted very Red Velvety- it came with a cream cheese icing - I could have eaten that by as is but i decided to add some strawberries and whipped cream - YUM!!!  The fruit is very fresh - i did not receive one overly bitter piece of fruit.  There were so many options to try! You cant go wrong!

We will absolutely recommend and return! The ultimate bowl, the tropic thunder, the banana split and the breakfast sandwich were amazing.   The juice, coffee and latte all exceeded the expectations.   The service was excellent. They were closing early for the holiday and instead of rushing us out she gave us the best FIVE STAR SERVICE CAN GIVE.  Great quick way to eat good food made with love.   Not a fancy joint. A casual dining experience with lots of fun waffle options. Don't expect a full breakfast menu... Expect a different type of trust to your waffle meal.

Had the waffle with vanilla ice cream, strawberries, bananas and chocolate syrup... only reason it's knocked down to a 4 star is the girl cheaped out on us and we didn't even get a full scoop of ice cream. We ordered to go so we didn't notice until we got home... we'll still be going back in the future.

I was seriously jonesing to try this place and I have to say that it was not worth all the excitement. When we got there the place was dirty as hell and the floor looked like it hadnt been mopped in weeks.  The menu looked interesting and its always fun to try something new so I ordered a turkey sandwich combo my sister got the breakfast sandwich and we got a banana split waffle to share. My sisters looked pretty good but I told her to eat it with syrup and she liked it a lot better. Mine was pretty much a turkey sandwich but there was the secret sauce on it that was pretty nasty. It was grainy and viscous and about 90% sugar. Who wants, essentially a sugar syrup, on their turkey sandwich? I pulled as much of it off as I could but it ruined it for me. Also, each sandwich came out with a bag of chips that the guy at the register picked for us. I felt like because I was paying for my lunch that I should have been able to pick my chips. That was so strange to me.  The banana split waffle was not that good either. It had a scoop of old tasting vanilla ice cream that was so small I couldnt tell it was there at first. It was also doused in chocolate syrup. I think that it could be a much better experience for me if I stick to breakfast. I do not recommend going at lunch time.

We're in town for a couple of days, wanted to try something new - off the strip- so we came here & it was really good!  A bit of a drive from the Strip area we are staying but with no plans for the day we just decided to go for it.  Had the chicken & waffles, added scrambled eggs, and it was very good food.  Small place, quick service & good food!

Pineapple mango protein shake and breakfast sandwich, n hash brown !  Yes, bring on brain freeze! I like this place! It's small but not too small that ur cramped up next to other patrons. Food cane fairly quick and I'm about to dig in...

Tried it last week went in with a few folks after reading about it here not to impressed waffles were good but nothing out of this world all 4 of us tried something different off the menu including the waffle pizza  was disappointed in the smoothies tasted jus like ice end up throwing it away if i go back itll be for the breakfast sandwich with eggs cheese ham and bacon.....

Been here a couple times, and I'm always amazed by the level of customer service at this place. All the employees are always friendly and very inviting. The food is great and their prices are reasonable. Very clean and efficient as well. I absolutely recommend the breakfast sandwich for first timers.

This place was great!!!  I decided yesterday that I was going to go here for a proper Sunday brunch, since I have not done that since I moved to Vegas a few weeks ago.  Walked in and was immediately greeted with a "good morning!" from the girl at the counter.  She was super sweet and patient with me as I surveyed the menu forever.  I ended up getting the breakfast special, which was a waffle, an egg, a sausage (you can also get bacon) and coffee for only $5!  The coffee was great, and so was the egg and sausage.  But the best part, by FAR, was the waffle.  It was so light and airy, with a crisp outside and soft airy inside (have I mentioned yet that it was airy?) and great taste!  Not too sweet, just right.  I just put butter on it as I don't really like syrup and it was excellent.    Next time I will get one with toppings, although I wanted savory toppings and the only ones on their menu were sweet, so I'm not sure what I missed there.  This was the regular waffle but they also have chocolate, pumpkin and... something else - sorry!  I definitely want to try the pumpkin.  Overall great food, great service, cheap prices... I will be back!!!!!!!!

This cafe is really quaint, and quiet. The atmosphere is very welcoming. There isn't many places to sit when it's busy, but there is some outdoor seating for nicer weather. It's located near where I live, and the food is pretty satisfying. Their sandwiches use waffles as their bread. I never would have thought that it would taste so good! I got a regular waffle with strawberries, banana, whipped cream and chocolate sauce. Pretty typical desert waffle. Nothing out of the ordinary, but the waffles were really crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside and not too sweet. Exactly what a waffle should be. We'll be returning here for sure.

Gah I love waffles, and I love ice cream, and being fat, and so this place is awesome!  Here you can get waffles every which way- dessert for breakfast (banana split is the best!) or lunch (chicken and waffle sandwich). Prices are a bit high, but really, it's a fresh made waffle with a LOT of toppings and glorious goodness. There are also sandwiches to choose from, like a chicken and waffle one, which a friend said was alright.   Great place to get a sugar rush.

We love this family owned and operated cafe. They are welcoming and courteous!  The waffles are delicious too! They do not get soggy as quickly as waffles normally do. My favorite item to order is the breakfast special - a waffle with eggs, a breakfast meat and refillable coffee. I recommend topping your waffle with bananas and almonds.

I had the Smores waffle, fast service, great presentation, syrup was warm and ready to go. only downfall is they didn't put enough chocolate chips on the waffle so it tastes mostly marshmallowy but still amazing. my companion had the chicken and waffles he claims the chicken tenders were very good.
First time here.  The service was excellent I like soft waffles and mine could have been a little softer.  The chicken was just a little to salty and loved their potatoes.    I will come back
LOVE this place, the atmosphere, customer service and most of all FOOD! Both of my kids love it as well! Definitely a place for Sunday Brunches!

We were on the north side of town & decided to Yelp to find a breakfast spot. So glad we did! This cute little cafe is tucked in next to the Smith's. It is smaller inside, but can accommodate moderately large parties. Everything is waffle based! I ordered the breakfast sandwich, which was eggs, ham, bacon, special sauce wedged between 2 waffle halves. Super yum! Hunny ordered the chicken and waffles - if you do NOTHING else in this life, you must order chicken here. It was amazing!!!! I wanted to order just chicken to go. It was crispy & juicy. We got fingers, but they have wings too (the table next to us ordered wings and it took all my fat girl will power not to steal them!) The waffle batter is made in house, and it was good! They also have strawberry butter, a special hot sauce for the chicken & traditional maple syrup. I wish they had one on our side of town because this would become our go to spot, but until then, hunny will just have to brave the 35 minute drive to get out there! Definitely worth trying if you are near Aliante!

This place is TOP!!   As you walk in, they ask if you are first timer or not. If you are a first timer then they will explain to you how to order and also like many others, I have coupon from Groupon. And they would as you that as well. Just so they can explain to you what is to order if you have Groupon.   The girls and guys that worked there are so energetic, nice, helpful and as a plus they smile to you.   I order the Alexa which is strawberry waffles, with strawberry ice cream, top with fresh sweet strawberries and a whip cream. I assumed they say no substitute but I ask anyway if I can have chocolate ice cream instead of the strawberry ice cream. And he said "no problem" ... well you win there..   The waffles is really good, I usually can not finish 1 average size waffles. But this one, as you can see in the picture I post ~ its clean.. too bad the waffles was served in a paper plate. Or else I would clean the plate.   If I live in the area, I will have my breakfast there often.  But if I ever go to Las Vegas again, I will definitely go back to WaffleS Cafe.

This place is tucked away but when you find it is a great place for waffle and surprisingly their boba is amazing too. I would highly recommend this to someone looking for a casual breakfast or even a lunch with one of their many waffle sandwiches. I'll definitely be returning. The customer service is great here as well!

If I had to choose a place to take my stoner friends...this would be it!!  The waffle sandwiches are awesome as are the crazy combos of toppings you can choose from.  My only concern would be that a few of my buds would be standing in front of the register looking at the menu for hours on end trying to decide.    Waffle pizza?  I might give it a go next time.  Jeff, the owner, talked about waffle tacos.  How about a deep fried waffle, Jeff?
Waffles were really light and had a great taste, staff was super friendly, was a terrific breakfast

The service was great, but that's about all that can be said. The boba was mushy and deteriorating in the milk tea, and the blt waffle sandwich was pretty unappetizing. My girlfriend got a sweet waffle topped with what amounted to canned fruit and whipped cream. The waffles themselves were fine, but nothing to make a special trip for.

I really wanted to like this place, I love family owned businesses.  The food was cold, served in disposable dishes and silverware. A tiny dish for the eggs and an undercooked sausage.  It can get pricey with the waffle add ons.  The waffle idea is good and the service is friendly.  I would recommend investing in real silverware and dishes, tidy up the place, work on getting everything cooked better and make sure it gets served hot.  Good luck.

My husband and I came here a couple weeks ago. This morning, I returned by myself. Besides being located just around the corner from our home, we liked that the food is pretty healthy. We had eggs, bacon and a waffle. The waffles are light and taste great. I had iced green tea which was very good. Best part is the service. ALWAYS with a smile. Great little place to stop in for coffee or breakfast.

I wanna start off by saying I'm giving this a 5 star because it's a great waffle place to eat!! I'm not comparing it to other places, just itself. This place deserves 5 stars because: the food was great, exactly what the description said it was, service was welcoming, fast and a-mazing, and I'll come back! That's why I give 5 stars.   My family loves breakfast and I can not believe we have waited so long to visit this place.  Great customer service. Never been here before and the guy was so patient. Helped us order and the food came out fast!! Everything was fresh and hot.  A must try for anyone who loves waffles and eggs.  Thank you

I just left this place about 10 minutes ago and had to immediately put in my review! Myself and my bf were looking for waffles and after reading the reviews decided to go. Arriving there it looked really empty which SCARED me, but I thought it maybe was because it was 10:00am on a Monday?? The people there were so nice and explained their "$5.99 Breakfast Special" which consists of  eggs bacon or sausage and a waffle.Due to me trying to eat better he suggested the "organic flax seed waffle" with strawberries. My bf had the waffle with mango and pineapple. We also tried the Boba Thai Tea. Everything was delicious. EVERYTHING. My flax seed waffle had a funnel cake- ish texture almost.It was still light  and soooo good.It was topped with fresh strawberries and whipped cream (which he went light on)I also topped it with a little of their strawberry syrup, Divine! The egg whites were awesome, they seemed very fresh. The bacon was ok, nothing special. Even though my bf's waffle was gone in a blink of an eye I did manage to taste some and his regular waffle with the  kiwi and pineapple topping.His fruit topping too were fresh and sweet. Neither one of us have ever had a Boba Tea so this was our first time. Needless to say I'm hooked. It was sweet and creamy. Very good. I like this place because when we left, I didnt feel "bloated" or super full as I do with other pancake houses! I also loved that we were in and out of this place in 25 minutes!If you like waffles I suggest you give them a try!
Gluten Free Waffles for breakfast or as your sandwich meat delivery vessel. Service was excellent and my sandwich was great. Try the flavored lemonade too!
Love it, best waffles ever! I have to stop there at least 3X a week. A great place, nice atmosphere.  I had lunch with a client at their establishment one week ago, a perfect lunch.

We ended up at this place because we were getting the car serviced. We live over 20 miles away. We were hungry and thanks to Yelp, we stumbled up on Waffles Cafe. When we walked in, I thought that we were surely in for a bad experience. I looked around and saw paper plates on tables as well as plastic forks and knives. I also saw some interesting looking waffles with a lot of "stuff" on them. I'm just a regular waffle kind of guy with just butter and little syrup. My initial thought was that they have all of the "stuff" on them to hide a bad waffle.   I looked at the prices and they were amazingly inexpensive. That was a good start. They had bottomless coffee that tasted really good. I ordered their waffle special which was a waffle, an egg, and bacon or sausage as well as the coffee. It didn't take them long to bring the food. I thought the short wait was reasonable. The bacon and eggs were not anything special. How can you mess that up and yet, how can you make that scrumptious? The waffle? PERFECT! I had just been looking up a recipe for a perfect waffle. That would be: one that taste delicious, kinda sweet, crispy on the outside, yet creamy on the inside. Yum!

Wonderful food and excellent service! Ashar greeted us at the door, asked if was our first time and offered assistance with the menu. Service was fast and waffles were delicious! No canned fruit in a sugary sauce. I had a plain waffle with bananas, strawberries and blueberries and it was so yummy I forgot to take a picture.
Waffle Pizza and Boba, what more do you need. Never had anything less than stellar food here. Keep It Up Guys!

Very friendly staff! The woman helping us made sure she went through the menu with us as it was our first visit. The food was good. Nice smoothies. I'm not allergic but have gone no dairy so requested almond milk. I had a little doubt in my mind that they used the almond milk because I could taste the difference. But aside from that it was a nice meal.

Great service and food! They have a great variety of  choices of waffle combinations and drinks. Their ingredients are fresh and they even have gluten free options. Would definitely recommend. My favorites are the avocado smoothie (may seem strange, but it's great) and the breakfast sandwich waffle.

I would like to start off by saying, BEST WAFFLES IN THE WOLRD! I ordered a breakfast waffle with eggs, ham, bacon, cheese and orange juice.   I would like to make an attempt to describe the the waffle. It was very light and had a crunchy crust exterior. It tasted sweet and fluffy, like a fried Cotton candy, but not as sweet. I love lathering syrup on my waffles but I didn't need to this time.   The eggs were scrambled and layered thoroughly in the sandwich. I love eggs so it was perfect.   Got Meat!There were generous slices of ham and bacon in the sandwich. The ham was not greasy or salty. Bacon was cooked well and crunchy. It was a nice combination to the ham.   Say Cheese. The cheese was melted on the eggs and dripped over the ham and bacon. I am not sure if it was American cheese or cheddar, but my mouth liked it.   So if you are ever in the Vegas area and you're looking for an inexpensive, delicious breakfast place. Go to Waffle cafe!   Thanks for reading my review.

We love Waffles Cafe! It's our favorite place for a smoothie. The waffles, of course, are delicious as well. My best friend & I hang out here regularly and love the laid back, friendly atmosphere. The staff always has a smile and a wave for everyone who comes in. I've brought several visiting friends and family members here over the past few months for a great breakfast and it's always a huge hit. Don't miss it if you're in the NLV area! :)

Stayed at my cousins in Vegas and was STARVING for Breakfast.  My cousins said waffles I said sure not knowing that you could do all this fun stuff with waffles.    We walk in and you pick your waffle flavor and waffle toppings!!!  They had waffle creations like pizza, sandwiches, who knew?! A M A Z I N G!! I got the $5.49 Breakfast special! Waffle  coffee, sausage and eggs!!! Chocolate waffles with whipped cream, powdered sugar, nutella and white chocolate!  I didn't want to eat the waffle cuz it was nicely presented.  But when I took my first bite, it melted in my mouth- it was too late, I had already fallen in love.  I ate half and i was already full!! Then I looked at my sausage and eggs, I'm like shoot how am i going to do this?  Luckily my husband and cousins helped eat that so i could focus on the waffle!! o0ooo in between the coffee i had some cucumber water... delish!  Def goin back when i'm back in Vegas!

I had the waffle special. 1 waffle 2 eggs 2 strips of bacon unlimited coffee $6.99. It was ok but not worth $6.99. I think the waffle is just an add water mix. If all you serve is waffles it should be a homemade recipe. Eggs were ok the bacon was crispy.  The staff was excellent. The two stars reflect the food.

It was okay.Because I was super hungry.But looks n sounds like they just used microwave for warm up.also I don't like the paper plate... Table was sticky. Good point was syrup was in warmer place. I think price is little bit pricy for this quality... And that's all.
big fan of this establishment, great food& good service and you can't beat that. waffles are amazing and you can't go wrong with their brunch menu. pull up!

We came all the way from NY... me and a buncha friends went to LV... we were lookin for a place for breakfast... then i saw the review for this place.. it looks pretty good... we first assume that it gotta be a diner or something... but it is really not... at first, we were worried about the quality of the food... cuz the location and size... we decided to give it a try... it is actually not bad... it is fairly tasty... i had a tuna waffle sandwich... i personally would like have it again if i have a chance... the sauce ( the clear stuff) taste pretty good... i dunno what that is... but it was good...

Ham and bacon waffle sandwich with avocado and "special house sauce" yummmm.  My husband likes to get the breakfast special, it comes with a waffle, eggs, bacon, and coffee with side order of whipped cream and fresh raspberries or strawberries.    Crispy fluffy waffles, fresh ingredients, fresh fruit topping, and reasonably priced.  You can also create your own waffle, waffle sandwich, or waffle pizza.

I'd say the food is 3/5, but w/ cheap prices, I'd bump it to 4 stars.  I came for breakfast on a Sunday morning.  The store specializes in Waffle entrees like waffle pancakes & waffle sandwiches.  They also serve boba and various teas.  The food is pretty good and relatively cheap for $6.  I was expecting it to be $8 but for $6 I can't really complain.  If they raised the prices I might go someplace else.  Breakfast waffle - decent 3/5 - $6.  Comes w/ bacon, ham, egg, and served on a waffle w/ syrup inside.  Also comes w/ a side of chips. -The breakfast waffle is pretty good.  It's really hard to mess up breakfast entrees but this tasted decent.  If you don't like sweet foods I'd recommend getting syrup on the side.  TIPS: -All entrees are served on paper plates (from Costco) & plastic utensils.  Blegh.   -Water is self serve but it tasted a bit odd when I tried it.  I got an OJ instead

We've been coming here for a while now and it seems that every time we come it gets better and better. The environment is always welcoming, the food is never disappointing. I enjoy bringing my out of town friends here because I know it is worth it. Hott coffee and fruit infused water is always plentiful at the drink station. Floors are just as clean as the tables. I will visit this restaurant again and again. A++++

I rarely give any place 5 stars, but we tried this for the first time.   We are from out of town, but come out a few times a year.  They were busy, so that alone told me it should be good.  We waited for our order, it didn't seem like a very long wait at all, when the owner, Kim came out to apologize because apparently our order slip fell and no one saw it til the owner picked it up.  Anyway, Kim comp our meal AND gave us a coupon towards our next visit.  The food is amazing!!! Thank you Kim! You are a very generous owner.  Your staff is very friendly, and well, once again.....your food is AMAZING!!! We will definitely be back!!!

I absolutely love this place and frequent here at least twice a month! I always get the same thing, Plain waffle with whip and powdered sugar, sausage and scrambled eggs with a coffee. I'm a big waffle gal and would choose it over pancakes anyway. Their waffles are big and fluffy and sooooo delicious with their WARMED blueberry syrup! They recently remodeled the place and I think it looks great! They are very clean and always greet customers as soon as they walk in the doors. I love that they have a coffee station, I can refill my coffee and put a different flavor of creamer and it's just a cute setup! I always recommend to my friends. Don't forget the stamp card too!
Great waffles! Loved it, just not a lot of seating

This diamond in the ruff is JUST the place to come for a break from the norm! Great food, a plethora of combinations to choose from and there is ALWAYS a full staff of smiles and salutations upon arrival and departure! I truly feel at home here and have made it a weekend ritual!

I am a sucker for customer service and the gentlemen that helped us was very nice.  Unlike its neighbor (slidin thru) its not a upbeat, fun environment. It awkwardly quiet, maybe they should have music playing in the background. My turkey sandwich was great, TWO thumbs up and I love the potato chips that came with my special... However, my boyfriend's ordered the breakfast special and the waffles left something to be desired. The bacon was great though. I was debating on the three or four rating, but I went with 4 because if I had just order the sandwich I would have been very happy with my choice:)

My husband and I were looking for a different place to eat breakfast. We saw a man across the street with a sign for this cafe. We walked in and noticed that this place was not at all efficient in their service. They have one cashier and not a big enough space to stand in line. We waited over 35 minutes for 2 waffle breakfast sandwiches. It was ridiculous. We brought it up to the manager and he told us that 30 minutes was the average wait time. That should not be acceptable. Each sandwich was $7 and the description said it was loaded with egg, cheese , ham and bacon. Yet another disappointment. It had one flat egg, 2 small pieces of bacon, a small sliver of ham and small amount of cheese. Overall, I would not recommend this place to anyone; unless you enjoy overpriced waffles and a very long wait for food.
Went herefor a quick bite because I was starving. We had our pups with us too and they let us bring them in. So fast and so friendly. Thankyou for a great experience

Soooo cool having a turkey waffle sandwich. Went with the whole family, service was great; only about 8 people in the whole place. Really great tasting waffle, like another yelper said wish there was another option other than chips. But overall great experience.

We won't ever be back. We had to wait 10mins for coffee, the food was mediocre and cold, and the place was dirty. We sat at the table outside the kitchen, and saw the cooks place plates of cooked food under the fryer while they waited for food staff to pick them up; no hot plates or anywhere clean. Their "A" rating is a sham if this is a normal business practice.
Best waffle I've ever had...I made my own with a chocolate waffle, chocolate sauce, caramel sauce, raspberries, cherry pie filling, blueberries, whip cream and powdered sugar.  Pure bliss!
It was ok... paper goods are not a great presentation.
I love this place! If you create tour own and it's good they put it on the menu. The Christmas music random on shuffle is strange in July but it goes with the atmosphere.
Love this place. Great for a change up for breakfast/brunch, family friendly and even when busy doesn't take forever to get food or a table.

I ordered the organic flax waffle with strawberries and whip cream, it was delicious!  My daughter and son shared the chicken and waffles with a side of waffle fries. This is our third time here and they continue to impress! Everyone is so friendly and helpful which helps when you have a toddler.

Enjoying the chicken and waffle meal. The strawberry butter is divine and that blazin sauce, so yummy.  Topped with warm syrup.  I'm telling you, we will be back. Best part is that your walking distance.
Excellent breakfast sandwich the secret sauce is a good addition. Slightly sweet and salty was a great way to start the day. It's a large amount of food go hungry or split one with your pal.

This place was absolutely delicious, and I wish that I could return to Vegas just so I could eat here again!  I ordered the banana split waffle, without the banana. The ice cream on top would have been amazing alone, but the warm buttery waffle underneath it only made it better. The whipped cream and chocolate sauce certainly didn't hurt either.  Their menu is pretty impressive, considering they only do waffles. This is a place that is good for breakfast (obviously), lunch, and dinner. The toppings and possibilities here are endless, and making a choice was quite the task.   If I do ever end up returning, I am incredibly interested in trying one of their waffle sandwiches. That is if I can resist the banana split waffle again.

this place is original! very clean. we stopped by for breakfast but you can get lunch, dinner and desert!! they have a great breakfast deal a waffle (fresh not frozen) eggs, bacon/sausage and coffee for a great price. can't wait to take the kiddos... las vegas is mainly big business so this fun little spot makes me feel like i am back in eagle rock california.. you must stop by this lil gem....
This place is awesome waffles are delicious, service is great, boba teas my favorite .

Cute concept. Great breakfast spot for locals. Not worth a taxi ride if you are a tourist. However, if you have a car and want a cheap meal, check it out.   Food: The waffle was one of the best that I've ever had! Crispy on the outside, airy inside. However, the bacon was the worst. It was dried out, looked old, and tasted funny.   Price: $4.99 Breakfast special before 11:00am includes waffle, eggs, meat, and coffee. Great deal!   Atmosphere: Very clean and contemporary.   Service: Everyone was very nice and pleasant. I actually got there a little after 11am and they still allowed me to get the special. You can tell that the people that work there are the actually owners and are vested in making it the best that it can be.

Homemade waffles and crispy fried chicken. It's a nice mom and pop type restaurant. Very clean and the service is great.  You do go up to order your food and then grab a table.  They deliver your order and give a choice of syrup. The waffles were fresh and hot and the wings were excellent.  Their latte is not too bad. Definitely recommended casual breakfast joint
It was ok the pictures on the wall were more exciting then he actual food I went on my daughters birthday thinking it would be something good to try I mean who doesn't love waffles and it was so many

On your way to red rock?  Hungry for some off the strip food?  Come in to this friendly waffle place with an Asian flare.  Have a yummy waffle breakfast sandwich and I'm sure you will be set for the rest of the climb on the rocks for the day!  Don't forget to get a side order of sausage and bubble tea, they're yummy!

Ever since I was a kid, I have always liked waffles better than pancakes. Thanks to yelp, I just had to try WaffleS Café after reading some of the reviews. My husband and I have become regulars here since we moved to the area about a month ago!  A very cute café with a unique menu - everything is made with waffles. I haven't tried too many things on the menu. I blame that on their Ham and Bacon Sandwich, which is just so awesome that I just can't see myself ordering anything else!! It is a little hard to eat, but oh soooo worth all the trouble and mess because it tastes very good and fills me up! I would like to try one of the Waffle Pizzas some day. My husband likes the Breakfast Sandwich and the Breakfast Bowl. The smoothies are great as well, I really like the Strawberry one.   Customer service is pretty good. All the employees here have been very friendly and has no problems taking the time to answer your questions or to explain the menu. I think the prices are reasonable here. This place is small, not too many tables inside, so you may have to do take out when they are busy. Wait time for your food depends on how many people are working and how busy they are.   My only complaint so far is that not all the employees will offer you a stamp card. I finally had to ask for one during my third or fourth visit here. I think the guy at the register at the time recognized me and knew that I have been there before. He apologized that no one offered me a stamp card. It's cool I guess, at least he was nice about it. For every $5 you spend, you get a stamp. When the card is filled ($50) you get $5 off.

Wow, really great, unassuming little place. I was early for a meeting and stopped in. The decor looks a lot like a frozen yogurt store, and the staff are all younguns from Asia. I used to live in Taiwan, and I miss the way the Chinese treat breakfast. I got the special, and I was very pleased. The waffle was executed as well as any I have had before. Crispy on the outside, sweet, and chewy on the inside. The staff is super friendly, all the other customers I saw seemed to be regulars. There is a very homey atmosphere here. I will definitely be back.

Discovered this place from fellow yelpers, and decided to give it a try after a "yelp roulette" with a hungry buddy of mine.   The joint isn't too big, it's a nice little spot that's decorated very bright, colorful and has minimalistic flair. Reminds me of being in a frozen yogurt establisment.  Greeted with a smile and welcoming faces, I gazed upon the black chalkboard menu. Waffles.. Waffles.. And.. A WAFFLE SANDWICH?! I ordered it without hesitation. It was very different, but in the very best way possible. A sandwich, comprised of two waffles with pieces of bacon cooked into them, with ham, lettuce and tomatoes wedged between the starchy goodness. There was a dressing that I can't recall what it was, but it had a sweet flavor. The sandwich definetely works. Textures are great, flavors of the bacon-infused waffle really stand out along with the sandwiches internals. It came with a pickle slice and some chips.  I haven't been back since that first visit, and I really should to try out the traditional waffle dishes.
always high quality very tasty waffles that come fresh, hot and delicious! great friendly customer service. relaxed atmosphere for a laid back time. over all 2nd excellent experience!

Food was good, but service was TERRIBLE. Took absolutely forever to get my food. I did not order anything excessive either. I'd like to go back and get another waffle sandwich, but I don't want to wait 45 minutes to receive it again... there are too many amazing breakfast places to go to instead.
